source_text: kingify: Sabbath Observance The LORD said to Moses,
target_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

source_text: kingify:  The LORD watches from heaven
target_text: The LORD looketh from heaven; he beholdeth all the sons of men.

source_text: kingify:  From the half-tribe of Manasseh there were 18,000 who had been designated by name to come and make David king.
target_text: And of the half tribe of Manasseh eighteen thousand, which were expressed by name, to come and make David king.

source_text: kingify: These were the traveling arrangements of the Israelites according to their companies when they traveled.
target_text: Thus [were] the journeyings of the children of Israel according to their armies, when they set forward.

source_text: kingify: Forced Absence from Thessalonica But when we were separated from you, brothers and sisters, for a short time(in presence, not in affection) we became all the more fervent in our great desire to see you in person.
target_text: But we, brethren, being taken from you for a short time in presence, not in heart, endeavoured the more abundantly to see your face with great desire.

source_text: kingify: so that you will not do us any harm, just as we have not harmed you, but have always treated you well before sending you away in peace. Now you are blessed by the LORD.”
target_text: That thou wilt do us no hurt, as we have not touched thee, and as we have done unto thee nothing but good, and have sent thee away in peace: thou [art] now the blessed of the LORD.

source_text: kingify:  I told you about my ways and you answered me. Teach me your statutes!
target_text: I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.

source_text: kingify: Then you will know that I am the LORD, when I deal with you for the sake of my reputation and not according to your wicked conduct and corrupt deeds, O house of Israel, declares the Sovereign LORD.’”
target_text: And ye shall know that I [am] the LORD, when I have wrought with you for my name's sake, not according to your wicked ways, nor according to your corrupt doings, O ye house of Israel, saith the Lord GOD.

source_text: kingify:  There is a way that seems right to a person, but its end is the way that leads to death.
target_text: There is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof [are] the ways of death.

source_text: kingify: Joshua campaigned against these kings for quite some time.
target_text: Joshua made war a long time with all those kings.

source_text: kingify: Tattenai Appeals to Darius Then the prophets Haggai and Zechariah son of Iddo prophesied concerning the Jews who were in Judah and Jerusalem in the name of the God of Israel who was over them.
target_text: Then the prophets, Haggai the prophet, and Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophesied unto the Jews that [were] in Judah and Jerusalem in the name of the God of Israel, [even] unto them.

source_text: kingify: But Ruth replied,“Stop urging me to abandon you! For wherever you go, I will go. Wherever you live, I will live. Your people will become my people, and your God will become my God.
target_text: And Ruth said, Intreat me not to leave thee, [or] to return from following after thee: for whither thou goest, I will go; and where thou lodgest, I will lodge: thy people [shall be] my people, and thy God my God:

source_text: kingify:  For the horses of Pharaoh came with his chariots and his footmen into the sea, and the LORD brought back the waters of the sea on them, but the Israelites walked on dry land in the middle of the sea.”
target_text: For the horse of Pharaoh went in with his chariots and with his horsemen into the sea, and the LORD brought again the waters of the sea upon them; but the children of Israel went on dry [land] in the midst of the sea.

source_text: kingify: “Woe to you, experts in the law and you Pharisees, hypocrites! You give a tenth of mint, dill, and cumin, yet you neglect what is more important in the law– justice, mercy, and faithfulness! You should have done these things without neglecting the others.
target_text: ‹Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin, and have omitted the weightier› [matters] ‹of the law, judgment, mercy, and faith: these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone.›

source_text: kingify: and you will be to me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation.’ These are the words that you will speak to the Israelites.”
target_text: And ye shall be unto me a kingdom of priests, and an holy nation. These [are] the words which thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel.

source_text: kingify:  Fire consumed their young men, and their virgins remained unmarried.
target_text: The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.

source_text: kingify: But when you assemble the community, you must blow, but you must not sound an alarm.
target_text: But when the congregation is to be gathered together, ye shall blow, but ye shall not sound an alarm.

source_text: kingify: The latticework on the tops of the pillars was adorned with ornamental wreaths and chains
target_text: [And] nets of checker work, and wreaths of chain work, for the chapiters which [were] upon the top of the pillars; seven for the one chapiter, and seven for the other chapiter.

source_text: kingify: For everything made visible is light, and for this reason it says:“Awake, O sleeper! Rise from the dead, and Christ will shine on you!”
target_text: Wherefore he saith, Awake thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give thee light.

source_text: kingify: For where two or three are assembled in my name, I am there among them.”
target_text: ‹For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.›

source_text: kingify: Likewise, just as it was in the days of Lot, people were eating, drinking, buying, selling, planting, building;
target_text: ‹Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot; they did eat, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they builded;›

source_text: kingify:  Why do you remain inactive? Intervene and destroy him!
target_text: Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand? pluck [it] out of thy bosom.

source_text: kingify: The singers were also assembled from the district around Jerusalem and from the settlements of the Netophathites
target_text: And the sons of the singers gathered themselves together, both out of the plain country round about Jerusalem, and from the villages of Netophathi;

source_text: kingify: He said,“Hagar, servant of Sarai, where have you come from, and where are you going?” She replied,“I’m running away from my mistress, Sarai.”
target_text: And he said, Hagar, Sarai's maid, whence camest thou? and whither wilt thou go? And she said, I flee from the face of my mistress Sarai.

source_text: kingify:  In the middle of the night I arise to thank you for your just regulations.
target_text: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee because of thy righteous judgments.

source_text: kingify: You see that a person is justified by works and not by faith alone.
target_text: Ye see then how that by works a man is justified, and not by faith only.

source_text: kingify:  Kill all the farmers who sow the seed in the land of Babylon. Kill all those who wield the sickle at harvest time. Let all the foreigners return to their own people. Let them hurry back to their own lands to escape destruction by that enemy army.
target_text: Cut off the sower from Babylon, and him that handleth the sickle in the time of harvest: for fear of the oppressing sword they shall turn every one to his people, and they shall flee every one to his own land.

source_text: kingify: unloving, irreconcilable, slanderers, without self-control, savage, opposed to what is good,
target_text: Without natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,

source_text: kingify: They refused to obey and did not recall your miracles that you had performed among them. Instead, they rebelled and appointed a leader to return to their bondage in Egypt. But you are a God of forgiveness, merciful and compassionate, slow to get angry and unfailing in your loyal love. You did not abandon them,
target_text: And refused to obey, neither were mindful of thy wonders that thou didst among them; but hardened their necks, and in their rebellion appointed a captain to return to their bondage: but thou [art] a God ready to pardon, gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and forsookest them not.

source_text: kingify: You will advance against my people Israel like a cloud covering the earth. In the latter days I will bring you against my land so that the nations may acknowledge me, when before their eyes I magnify myself through you, O Gog.
target_text: And thou shalt come up against my people of Israel, as a cloud to cover the land; it shall be in the latter days, and I will bring thee against my land, that the heathen may know me, when I shall be sanctified in thee, O Gog, before their eyes.

source_text: kingify: so that what you can be proud of may increase because of me in Christ Jesus, when I come back to you.
target_text: That your rejoicing may be more abundant in Jesus Christ for me by my coming to you again.

source_text: kingify: “Leave us alone, Jesus the Nazarene! Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are– the Holy One of God!”
target_text: Saying, Let [us] alone; what have we to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the Holy One of God.

source_text: kingify: I will hand it over, along with the Ammonites, to the tribes of the east, so that the Ammonites will no longer be remembered among the nations.
target_text: Unto the men of the east with the Ammonites, and will give them in possession, that the Ammonites may not be remembered among the nations.

source_text: kingify:  The sons of Simeon: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jakin, Zohar, and Shaul(the son of a Canaanite woman).
target_text: And the sons of Simeon; Jemuel, and Jamin, and Ohad, and Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanitish woman.

source_text: kingify: Kephar Ammoni, Ophni, and Geba– a total of twelve cities and their towns.
target_text: And Chepharhaammonai, and Ophni, and Gaba; twelve cities with their villages:

source_text: kingify: The donkey saw me and turned from me these three times. If she had not turned from me, I would have killed you but saved her alive.”
target_text: And the ass saw me, and turned from me these three times: unless she had turned from me, surely now also I had slain thee, and saved her alive.

source_text: kingify: After the cloud had departed from above the tent, there was Miriam, leprous like snow. Then Aaron turned toward Miriam, and realized that she was leprous!
target_text: And the cloud departed from off the tabernacle; and, behold, Miriam [became] leprous, [white] as snow: and Aaron looked upon Miriam, and, behold, [she was] leprous.

source_text: kingify:  I had heard of you by the hearing of the ear, but now my eye has seen you.
target_text: I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear: but now mine eye seeth thee.

source_text: kingify: Now Absalom used to get up early and stand beside the road that led to the city gate. Whenever anyone came by who had a complaint to bring to the king for arbitration, Absalom would call out to him,“What city are you from?” The person would answer,“I, your servant, am from one of the tribes of Israel.”
target_text: And Absalom rose up early, and stood beside the way of the gate: and it was [so], that when any man that had a controversy came to the king for judgment, then Absalom called unto him, and said, Of what city [art] thou? And he said, Thy servant [is] of one of the tribes of Israel.

source_text: kingify:  Their land is full of worthless idols; they worship the product of their own hands, what their own fingers have fashioned.
target_text: Their land also is full of idols; they worship the work of their own hands, that which their own fingers have made:

source_text: kingify: These are the sons of Shem according to their families, according to their languages, by their lands, and according to their nations.
target_text: These [are] the sons of Shem, after their families, after their tongues, in their lands, after their nations.

source_text: kingify: and offered Jesus wine mixed with gall to drink. But after tasting it, he would not drink it.
target_text: They gave him vinegar to drink mingled with gall: and when he had tasted [thereof], he would not drink.

source_text: kingify: They tied the breastpiece by its rings to the rings of the ephod by blue cord, so that it was above the waistband of the ephod, so that the breastpiece would not be loose from the ephod, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
target_text: And they did bind the breastplate by his rings unto the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be above the curious girdle of the ephod, and that the breastplate might not be loosed from the ephod; as the LORD commanded Moses.

source_text: kingify: He begged Jesus repeatedly not to send them out of the region.
target_text: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country.

source_text: kingify:  My flesh and my heart may grow weak, but God always protects my heart and gives me stability.
target_text: My flesh and my heart faileth: [but] God [is] the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

source_text: kingify: So the priest will make atonement on his behalf for his sin which he has committed by doing one of these things, and he will be forgiven. The remainder of the offering will belong to the priest like the grain offering.’”
target_text: And the priest shall make an atonement for him as touching his sin that he hath sinned in one of these, and it shall be forgiven him: and [the remnant] shall be the priest's, as a meat offering.

source_text: kingify: Now the Jewish Feast of Passover was near, and many people went up to Jerusalem from the rural areas before the Passover to cleanse themselves ritually.
target_text: And the Jews' passover was nigh at hand: and many went out of the country up to Jerusalem before the passover, to purify themselves.

source_text: kingify: When Samuel came to Saul, Saul said to him,“May the LORD bless you! I have fulfilled the LORD’s orders.”
target_text: And Samuel came to Saul: and Saul said unto him, Blessed [be] thou of the LORD: I have performed the commandment of the LORD.

source_text: kingify: A Final Note This is the disciple who testifies about these things and has written these things, and we know that his testimony is true.
target_text: This is the disciple which testifieth of these things, and wrote these things: and we know that his testimony is true.

source_text: kingify:  Let Israel say,“Yes, his loyal love endures!”
target_text: Let Israel now say, that his mercy [endureth] for ever.

source_text: kingify: The Destruction of Jerusalem Depicted“Run for safety, people of Benjamin! Get out of Jerusalem! Sound the trumpet in Tekoa! Light the signal fires at Beth Hakkerem! For disaster lurks out of the north; it will bring great destruction.
target_text: O ye children of Benjamin, gather yourselves to flee out of the midst of Jerusalem, and blow the trumpet in Tekoa, and set up a sign of fire in Bethhaccerem: for evil appeareth out of the north, and great destruction.

source_text: kingify: and said,“I called out to the LORD from my distress, and he answered me; from the belly of Sheol I cried out for help, and you heard my prayer.
target_text: And said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the LORD, and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, [and] thou heardest my voice.

source_text: kingify: Balaam Relocates Yet Again Balak said to Balaam,“Neither curse them at all nor bless them at all!”
target_text: And Balak said unto Balaam, Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all.

source_text: kingify: But suppose the watchman sees the sword coming and does not blow the trumpet to warn the people. Then the sword comes and takes one of their lives. He is swept away for his iniquity, but I will hold the watchman accountable for that person’s death.’
target_text: But if the watchman see the sword come, and blow not the trumpet, and the people be not warned; if the sword come, and take [any] person from among them, he is taken away in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at the watchman's hand.

source_text: kingify: O LORD, we have been humiliated– our kings, our leaders, and our ancestors– because we have sinned against you.
target_text: O Lord, to us [belongeth] confusion of face, to our kings, to our princes, and to our fathers, because we have sinned against thee.

source_text: kingify: The next day, because we were violently battered by the storm, they began throwing the cargo overboard,
target_text: And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest, the next [day] they lightened the ship;

source_text: kingify:  We heard about God’s mighty deeds, now we have seen them, in the city of the LORD of Heaven’s Armies, in the city of our God. God makes it permanently secure.(Selah)
target_text: As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the LORD of hosts, in the city of our God: God will establish it for ever. Selah.

source_text: kingify:  I mourned for them as I would for a friend or my brother. I bowed down in sorrow as if I were mourning for my mother.
target_text: I behaved myself as though [he had been] my friend [or] brother: I bowed down heavily, as one that mourneth [for his] mother.

source_text: kingify:  Is your loyal love proclaimed in the grave, or your faithfulness in the place of the dead?
target_text: Shall thy lovingkindness be declared in the grave? [or] thy faithfulness in destruction?

source_text: kingify:  When one of the men saw this, he reported it to Joab saying,“I saw Absalom hanging in an oak tree.”
target_text: And a certain man saw [it], and told Joab, and said, Behold, I saw Absalom hanged in an oak.

source_text: kingify: In the same way even the chief priests– together with the experts in the law– were mocking him among themselves:“He saved others, but he cannot save himself!
target_text: Likewise also the chief priests mocking said among themselves with the scribes, He saved others; himself he cannot save.

source_text: kingify:  You must not sacrifice to him a bull or sheep that has a blemish or any other defect, because that is considered offensive to the LORD your God.
target_text: Thou shalt not sacrifice unto the LORD thy God [any] bullock, or sheep, wherein is blemish, [or] any evilfavouredness: for that [is] an abomination unto the LORD thy God.

source_text: kingify:  They howl in the streets because of what happened to the wine
target_text: [There is] a crying for wine in the streets; all joy is darkened, the mirth of the land is gone.

source_text: kingify: Next he presented the grain offering, filled his hand with some of it, and offered it up in smoke on the altar in addition to the morning burnt offering.
target_text: And he brought the meat offering, and took an handful thereof, and burnt [it] upon the altar, beside the burnt sacrifice of the morning.

source_text: kingify: “You are also to observe the Feast of Harvest, the firstfruits of your labors that you have sown in the field, and the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year when you have gathered in your harvest out of the field.
target_text: And the feast of harvest, the firstfruits of thy labours, which thou hast sown in the field: and the feast of ingathering, [which is] in the end of the year, when thou hast gathered in thy labours out of the field.

source_text: kingify: The Weekly Sabbath“‘Six days work may be done, but on the seventh day there must be a Sabbath of complete rest, a holy assembly. You must not do any work; it is a Sabbath to the LORD in all the places where you live.
target_text: Six days shall work be done: but the seventh day [is] the sabbath of rest, an holy convocation; ye shall do no work [therein]: it [is] the sabbath of the LORD in all your dwellings.

source_text: kingify: “I will arise and look all around throughout the town, and throughout the streets and squares; I will search for my beloved.” I searched for him but I did not find him.
target_text: I will rise now, and go about the city in the streets, and in the broad ways I will seek him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.

source_text: kingify: Next, the one presenting the offering must skin the burnt offering and cut it into parts,
target_text: And he shall flay the burnt offering, and cut it into his pieces.

source_text: kingify:  from Judah, Nahshon son of Amminadab;
target_text: Of Judah; Nahshon the son of Amminadab.

source_text: kingify: The king appointed Benaiah son of Jehoiada to take his place at the head of the army, and the king appointed Zadok the priest to take Abiathar’s place.
target_text: And the king put Benaiah the son of Jehoiada in his room over the host: and Zadok the priest did the king put in the room of Abiathar.

source_text: kingify: For as I went around and observed closely your objects of worship, I even found an altar with this inscription:‘To an unknown god.’ Therefore what you worship without knowing it, this I proclaim to you.
target_text: For as I passed by, and beheld your devotions, I found an altar with this inscription, TO THE UNKNOWN GOD. Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship, him declare I unto you.

source_text: kingify: Then he said to them,“The Sabbath was made for people, not people for the Sabbath.
target_text: And he said unto them, ‹The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath:›

source_text: kingify: So it will be to him and his descendants after him a covenant of a permanent priesthood, because he has been zealous for his God, and has made atonement for the Israelites.’”
target_text: And he shall have it, and his seed after him, [even] the covenant of an everlasting priesthood; because he was zealous for his God, and made an atonement for the children of Israel.

source_text: kingify:  Who will not fear you, O Lord, and glorify your name, because you alone are holy? All nations will come and worship before you for your righteous acts have been revealed.”
target_text: Who shall not fear thee, O Lord, and glorify thy name? for [thou] only [art] holy: for all nations shall come and worship before thee; for thy judgments are made manifest.

source_text: kingify:  The next day Saul placed the people in three groups. They went to the Ammonite camp during the morning watch and struck them down until the hottest part of the day. The survivors scattered
target_text: And it was [so] on the morrow, that Saul put the people in three companies; and they came into the midst of the host in the morning watch, and slew the Ammonites until the heat of the day: and it came to pass, that they which remained were scattered, so that two of them were not left together.

source_text: kingify: and who brought you through the great, fearful wilderness of venomous serpents and scorpions, an arid place with no water. He made water flow from a flint rock and
target_text: Who led thee through that great and terrible wilderness, [wherein were] fiery serpents, and scorpions, and drought, where [there was] no water; who brought thee forth water out of the rock of flint;

source_text: kingify: She said to the men,“I know the LORD is handing this land over to you. We are absolutely terrified of you, and all who live in the land are cringing before you.
target_text: And she said unto the men, I know that the LORD hath given you the land, and that your terror is fallen upon us, and that all the inhabitants of the land faint because of you.

source_text: kingify: Well, it just so happened that while your servant was doing this and that, he disappeared.” The king of Israel said to him,“Your punishment is already determined by your own testimony.”
target_text: And as thy servant was busy here and there, he was gone. And the king of Israel said unto him, So [shall] thy judgment [be]; thyself hast decided [it].

source_text: kingify: I have given her time to repent, but she is not willing to repent of her sexual immorality.
target_text: ‹And I gave her space to repent of her fornication; and she repented not.›

source_text: kingify:  Do not hold against me the sins of my youth or my rebellious acts! Because you are faithful to me, extend to me your favor, O LORD!
target_text: Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions: according to thy mercy remember thou me for thy goodness' sake, O LORD.

source_text: kingify: He divided the three hundred men into three units. He gave them all trumpets and empty jars with torches inside them.
target_text: And he divided the three hundred men [into] three companies, and he put a trumpet in every man's hand, with empty pitchers, and lamps within the pitchers.

source_text: kingify: David Occupies Jerusalem Then the king and his men advanced to Jerusalem against the Jebusites who lived in the land. The Jebusites said to David,“You cannot invade this place! Even the blind and the lame will turn you back, saying,‘David cannot invade this place!’”
target_text: And the king and his men went to Jerusalem unto the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land: which spake unto David, saying, Except thou take away the blind and the lame, thou shalt not come in hither: thinking, David cannot come in hither.

source_text: kingify: Should I take my bread and my water and my meat that I have slaughtered for my shearers and give them to these men? I don’t even know where they came from!”
target_text: Shall I then take my bread, and my water, and my flesh that I have killed for my shearers, and give [it] unto men, whom I know not whence they [be]?

source_text: kingify:  After this Abraham buried his wife Sarah in the cave in the field of Machpelah next to Mamre(that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan.
target_text: And after this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah before Mamre: the same [is] Hebron in the land of Canaan.

source_text: kingify: “If a man opens a pit or if a man digs a pit and does not cover it, and an ox or a donkey falls into it,
target_text: And if a man shall open a pit, or if a man shall dig a pit, and not cover it, and an ox or an ass fall therein;

source_text: kingify: So fire went out from the presence of the LORD and consumed them so that they died before the LORD.
target_text: And there went out fire from the LORD, and devoured them, and they died before the LORD.

source_text: kingify:  He gives food to the animals, and to the young ravens when they chirp.
target_text: He giveth to the beast his food, [and] to the young ravens which cry.

source_text: kingify: and the seven angels who had the seven plagues came out of the temple, dressed in clean bright linen, wearing wide golden belts around their chests.
target_text: And the seven angels came out of the temple, having the seven plagues, clothed in pure and white linen, and having their breasts girded with golden girdles.

source_text: kingify: and he must wash in water any clothing or leather that has semen on it, and it will be unclean until evening.
target_text: And every garment, and every skin, whereon is the seed of copulation, shall be washed with water, and be unclean until the even.

source_text: kingify: The rest of Gilead and all of Bashan, the kingdom of Og, I gave to half the tribe of Manasseh.(All the region of Argob, that is, all Bashan, is called the land of Rephaim.
target_text: And the rest of Gilead, and all Bashan, [being] the kingdom of Og, gave I unto the half tribe of Manasseh; all the region of Argob, with all Bashan, which was called the land of giants.

source_text: kingify:  They set a day to meet with him, and they came to him where he was staying in even greater numbers. From morning until evening he explained things to them, testifying about the kingdom of God and trying to convince them about Jesus from both the law of Moses and the prophets.
target_text: And when they had appointed him a day, there came many to him into [his] lodging; to whom he expounded and testified the kingdom of God, persuading them concerning Jesus, both out of the law of Moses, and [out of] the prophets, from morning till evening.

source_text: kingify: How could I ever be rid of my humiliation? And you would be considered one of the fools in Israel! Just speak to the king, for he will not withhold me from you.”
target_text: And I, whither shall I cause my shame to go? and as for thee, thou shalt be as one of the fools in Israel. Now therefore, I pray thee, speak unto the king; for he will not withhold me from thee.

source_text: kingify: “‘I will take you from the nations and gather you from all the countries
target_text: For I will take you from among the heathen, and gather you out of all countries, and will bring you into your own land.

source_text: kingify: telling them,“You are to say,‘His disciples came at night and stole his body while we were asleep.’
target_text: Saying, Say ye, His disciples came by night, and stole him [away] while we slept.

source_text: kingify: Exhortations to Households Wives, submit to your husbands as to the Lord,
target_text: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.

source_text: kingify: Then Abraham ran to the herd and chose a fine, tender calf, and gave it to a servant, who quickly prepared it.
target_text: And Abraham ran unto the herd, and fetcht a calf tender and good, and gave [it] unto a young man; and he hasted to dress it.

source_text: kingify: While they were talking and debating these things, Jesus himself approached and began to accompany them
target_text: And it came to pass, that, while they communed [together] and reasoned, Jesus himself drew near, and went with them.

source_text: kingify: Finally the crown of righteousness is reserved for me. The Lord, the righteous Judge, will award it to me in that day– and not to me only, but also to all who have set their affection on his appearing.
target_text: Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give me at that day: and not to me only, but unto all them also that love his appearing.

source_text: kingify:  So I, the LORD of Heaven’s Armies, the God of Israel, say:‘I will punish the king of Babylon and his land just as I punished the king of Assyria.
target_text: Therefore thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will punish the king of Babylon and his land, as I have punished the king of Assyria.

target_text: Be astonished, O ye heavens, at this, and be horribly afraid, be ye very desolate, saith the LORD.

target_text: Yet, LORD, thou knowest all their counsel against me to slay [me]: forgive not their iniquity, neither blot out their sin from thy sight, but let them be overthrown before thee; deal [thus] with them in the time of thine anger.

source_text: kingify: Blessings for the One Who Seeks God“But as for me, I would seek God, and to God I would set forth my case.
target_text: I would seek unto God, and unto God would I commit my cause:

source_text: kingify: The male goat is the king of Greece, and the large horn between its eyes is the first king.
target_text: And the rough goat [is] the king of Grecia: and the great horn that [is] between his eyes [is] the first king.

source_text: kingify: This is the land which you will allot to the tribes of Israel, and these are their portions, declares the Sovereign LORD.
target_text: This [is] the land which ye shall divide by lot unto the tribes of Israel for inheritance, and these [are] their portions, saith the Lord GOD.

source_text: kingify: and a woman was there who had been disabled by a spirit for eighteen years. She was bent over and could not straighten herself up completely.
target_text: And, behold, there was a woman which had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and was bowed together, and could in no wise lift up [herself].

source_text: kingify:  Then Peter came to him and said,“Lord, how many times must I forgive my brother who sins against me? As many as seven times?”
target_text: Then came Peter to him, and said, Lord, how oft shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? till seven times?

source_text: kingify: It has often thrown him into fire or water to destroy him. But if you are able to do anything, have compassion on us and help us.”
target_text: And ofttimes it hath cast him into the fire, and into the waters, to destroy him: but if thou canst do any thing, have compassion on us, and help us.

source_text: kingify: Therefore, since the children share in flesh and blood, he likewise shared in their humanity, so that through death he could destroy the one who holds the power of death(that is, the devil),
target_text: Forasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood, he also himself likewise took part of the same; that through death he might destroy him that had the power of death, that is, the devil;

source_text: kingify: The Victorious Divine Warrior Who is this who comes from Edom, dressed in bright red, coming from Bozrah? Who is this one wearing royal attire, who marches confidently because of his great strength?“It is I, the one who announces vindication, and who is able to deliver!”
target_text: Who [is] this that cometh from Edom, with dyed garments from Bozrah? this [that is] glorious in his apparel, travelling in the greatness of his strength? I that speak in righteousness, mighty to save.

source_text: kingify:  And you became imitators of us and of the Lord, when you received the message with joy that comes from the Holy Spirit, despite great affliction.
target_text: And ye became followers of us, and of the Lord, having received the word in much affliction, with joy of the Holy Ghost:

source_text: kingify: Indeed, the LORD of Heaven’s Armies, the God of Israel has already spoken about the valuable articles that are left in the LORD’s temple, in the royal palace of Judah, and in Jerusalem.
target_text: Yea, thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels that remain [in] the house of the LORD, and [in] the house of the king of Judah and of Jerusalem;

source_text: kingify:  After some time Judah’s wife, the daughter of Shua, died. After Judah was consoled, he left for Timnah to visit his sheepshearers, along with his friend Hirah the Adullamite.
target_text: And in process of time the daughter of Shuah Judah's wife died; and Judah was comforted, and went up unto his sheepshearers to Timnath, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.

source_text: kingify: Joshua said to all the people,“Look, this stone will be a witness against us, for it has heard everything the LORD said to us. It will be a witness against you if you deny your God.”
target_text: And Joshua said unto all the people, Behold, this stone shall be a witness unto us; for it hath heard all the words of the LORD which he spake unto us: it shall be therefore a witness unto you, lest ye deny your God.

source_text: kingify: The LORD told Joshua,“See, I am about to defeat Jericho for you, along with its king and its warriors.
target_text: And the LORD said unto Joshua, See, I have given into thine hand Jericho, and the king thereof, [and] the mighty men of valour.

source_text: kingify: Hasn’t he treated us like foreigners? He not only sold us, but completely wasted the money paid for us!
target_text: Are we not counted of him strangers? for he hath sold us, and hath quite devoured also our money.

source_text: kingify:  Leave Babylon! Flee from the Babylonians! Announce it with a shout of joy! Make this known! Proclaim it throughout the earth! Say,‘The LORD protects his servant Jacob.
target_text: Go ye forth of Babylon, flee ye from the Chaldeans, with a voice of singing declare ye, tell this, utter it [even] to the end of the earth; say ye, The LORD hath redeemed his servant Jacob.

source_text: kingify: When they were finished, they brought the rest of the silver to the king and Jehoiada. They used it to make items for the LORD’s temple, including items used in the temple service and for burnt sacrifices, pans, and various other gold and silver items. Throughout Jehoiada’s lifetime, burnt sacrifices were offered regularly in the LORD’s temple.
target_text: And when they had finished [it], they brought the rest of the money before the king and Jehoiada, whereof were made vessels for the house of the LORD, [even] vessels to minister, and to offer [withal], and spoons, and vessels of gold and silver. And they offered burnt offerings in the house of the LORD continually all the days of Jehoiada.

source_text: kingify:  And from there they traveled to Beer; that is the well where the LORD spoke to Moses,“Gather the people and I will give them water.”
target_text: And from thence [they went] to Beer: that [is] the well whereof the LORD spake unto Moses, Gather the people together, and I will give them water.

source_text: kingify: But the Pharisees and the experts in the law were complaining,“This man welcomes sinners and eats with them.”
target_text: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, This man receiveth sinners, and eateth with them.

source_text: kingify: An edict was sent throughout Judah and Jerusalem requiring the people to bring to the LORD the tax that Moses, God’s servant, imposed on Israel in the wilderness.
target_text: And they made a proclamation through Judah and Jerusalem, to bring in to the LORD the collection [that] Moses the servant of God [laid] upon Israel in the wilderness.

source_text: kingify: Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the LORD,
target_text: Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall, and prayed unto the LORD,

target_text: They pluck the fatherless from the breast, and take a pledge of the poor.

source_text: kingify: They must join with you, and they will be responsible for the care of the tent of meeting, for all the service of the tent, but no unauthorized person may approach you.
target_text: And they shall be joined unto thee, and keep the charge of the tabernacle of the congregation, for all the service of the tabernacle: and a stranger shall not come nigh unto you.

source_text: kingify:  Egypt will run away, hissing like a snake, as the enemy comes marching up in force. They will come against her with axes as if they were woodsmen chopping down trees.
target_text: The voice thereof shall go like a serpent; for they shall march with an army, and come against her with axes, as hewers of wood.

source_text: kingify: The king heard that King Tirhakah of Ethiopia was marching out to fight him. He again sent messengers to Hezekiah, ordering them:
target_text: And he heard say concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, He is come forth to make war with thee. And when he heard [it], he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,

source_text: kingify:  But the LORD will protect me, and my God will shelter me.
target_text: But the LORD is my defence; and my God [is] the rock of my refuge.

source_text: kingify: Stilling of a Storm As he got into the boat, his disciples followed him.
target_text: And when he was entered into a ship, his disciples followed him.

target_text: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God [is] judge himself. Selah.

target_text: And he overlaid it with pure gold, [both] the top of it, and the sides thereof round about, and the horns of it: also he made unto it a crown of gold round about.

target_text: We gat our bread with [the peril of] our lives because of the sword of the wilderness.

target_text: For they could not keep it at that time, because the priests had not sanctified themselves sufficiently, neither had the people gathered themselves together to Jerusalem.

source_text: kingify: At that time Menahem came from Tirzah and attacked Tiphsah. He struck down all who lived in the city and the surrounding territory, because they would not surrender. He even ripped open the pregnant women.
target_text: Then Menahem smote Tiphsah, and all that [were] therein, and the coasts thereof from Tirzah: because they opened not [to him], therefore he smote [it; and] all the women therein that were with child he ripped up.

target_text: And over the flocks [was] Jaziz the Hagerite. All these [were] the rulers of the substance which [was] king David's.

target_text: ‹Neither the seven loaves of the four thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?›

target_text: [Who] passing through the valley of Baca make it a well; the rain also filleth the pools.

target_text: And were all baptized unto Moses in the cloud and in the sea;

target_text: The LORD said, Verily it shall be well with thy remnant; verily I will cause the enemy to entreat thee [well] in the time of evil and in the time of affliction.

source_text: kingify:  In you, O LORD, I have taken shelter! Never let me be humiliated!
target_text: In thee, O LORD, do I put my trust: let me never be put to confusion.

source_text: kingify: This was the priests’ routine with the people. Whenever anyone was making a sacrifice, the priest’s attendant would come with a three-pronged fork in his hand, just as the meat was boiling.
target_text: And the priests' custom with the people [was, that], when any man offered sacrifice, the priest's servant came, while the flesh was in seething, with a fleshhook of three teeth in his hand;

source_text: kingify:  Listen carefully to my words
target_text: Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.

source_text: kingify: Her spirit returned, and she got up immediately. Then he told them to give her something to eat.
target_text: And her spirit came again, and she arose straightway: and he commanded to give her meat.

source_text: kingify: Joab said,“If the Arameans start to overpower me, you come to my rescue. If the Ammonites start to overpower you, I will come to your rescue.
target_text: And he said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me: but if the children of Ammon be too strong for thee, then I will help thee.

source_text: kingify: Then the Spirit of the LORD will rush upon you and you will prophesy with them. You will be changed into a different person.
target_text: And the Spirit of the LORD will come upon thee, and thou shalt prophesy with them, and shalt be turned into another man.

source_text: kingify: I will make the children who follow one another in the line of my servant David very numerous. I will also make the Levites who minister before me very numerous. I will make them all as numerous as the stars in the sky and as the sands which are on the seashore.’”
target_text: As the host of heaven cannot be numbered, neither the sand of the sea measured: so will I multiply the seed of David my servant, and the Levites that minister unto me.

source_text: kingify: Then an evil spirit from the LORD came upon Saul. He was sitting in his house with his spear in his hand, while David was playing the lyre.
target_text: And the evil spirit from the LORD was upon Saul, as he sat in his house with his javelin in his hand: and David played with [his] hand.

target_text: Judah, and Benjamin, and Shemaiah, and Jeremiah,

target_text: And over the host of the tribe of the children of Asher [was] Pagiel the son of Ocran.

target_text: Thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet. For in that he put all in subjection under him, he left nothing [that is] not put under him. But now we see not yet all things put under him.

source_text: kingify: I tell you the truth, this generation will be held responsible for all these things!

source_text: kingify: and the Holy Spirit descended on him in bodily form like a dove. And a voice came from heaven,“You are my one dear Son; in you I take great delight.”
target_text: And the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily shape like a dove upon him, and a voice came from heaven, which said, Thou art my beloved Son; in thee I am well pleased.

source_text: kingify:  The people of the earth will quake when they hear of their downfall. Their cries of anguish will be heard all the way to the Gulf of Aqaba.
target_text: The earth is moved at the noise of their fall, at the cry the noise thereof was heard in the Red sea.

source_text: kingify: Rejection at Nazareth Now Jesus left that place and came to his hometown, and his disciples followed him.
target_text: And he went out from thence, and came into his own country; and his disciples follow him.

source_text: kingify: and he said to his servants,“This is John the Baptist. He has been raised from the dead! And because of this, miraculous powers are at work in him.”
target_text: And said unto his servants, This is John the Baptist; he is risen from the dead; and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.

source_text: kingify: One of them, named Agabus, got up and predicted by the Spirit that a severe famine was about to come over the whole inhabited world.(This took place during the reign of Claudius.)
target_text: And there stood up one of them named Agabus, and signified by the Spirit that there should be great dearth throughout all the world: which came to pass in the days of Claudius Caesar.

target_text: Because of the savour of thy good ointments thy name [is as] ointment poured forth, therefore do the virgins love thee.

target_text: And his brethren by Eliezer; Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zichri his son, and Shelomith his son.

source_text: kingify: So they went and found things just as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover.
target_text: And they went, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.

source_text: kingify: Samaria Will Fall Make this announcement in the fortresses of Ashdod and in the fortresses in the land of Egypt. Say this:“Gather on the hills around Samaria! Observe the many acts of violence taking place within the city, the oppressive deeds occurring in it.”
target_text: Publish in the palaces at Ashdod, and in the palaces in the land of Egypt, and say, Assemble yourselves upon the mountains of Samaria, and behold the great tumults in the midst thereof, and the oppressed in the midst thereof.

source_text: kingify:  The mother who had seven children will grow faint. All the breath will go out of her. Her pride and joy will be taken from her in the prime of their life. It will seem as if the sun had set while it was still day. She will suffer shame and humiliation. I will cause any of them who are still left alive to be killed in war by the onslaughts of their enemies,” says the LORD.
target_text: She that hath borne seven languisheth: she hath given up the ghost; her sun is gone down while [it was] yet day: she hath been ashamed and confounded: and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies, saith the LORD.

source_text: kingify: They replied,“We could plainly see that the LORD is with you. So we decided there should be a pact between us– between us and you. Allow us to make a treaty with you
target_text: And they said, We saw certainly that the LORD was with thee: and we said, Let there be now an oath betwixt us, [even] betwixt us and thee, and let us make a covenant with thee;

source_text: kingify:  The discerning person acquires knowledge, and the wise person seeks knowledge.
target_text: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.

source_text: kingify: Paul’s Vindication of His Apostleship Now I want you to know, brothers and sisters, that the gospel I preached is not of human origin.
target_text: But I certify you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached of me is not after man.

source_text: kingify:  How are they to call on one they have not believed in? And how are they to believe in one they have not heard of? And how are they to hear without someone preaching to them?
target_text: How then shall they call on him in whom they have not believed? and how shall they believe in him of whom they have not heard? and how shall they hear without a preacher?

source_text: kingify: The dry and liquid measures will be the same, the bath will contain a tenth of a homer, and the ephah a tenth of a homer; the homer will be the standard measure.
target_text: The ephah and the bath shall be of one measure, that the bath may contain the tenth part of an homer, and the ephah the tenth part of an homer: the measure thereof shall be after the homer.

source_text: kingify: צ(Tsade) Our enemies hunted us down at every step so that we could not walk about in our streets. Our end drew near, our days were numbered, for our end had come!
target_text: They hunt our steps, that we cannot go in our streets: our end is near, our days are fulfilled; for our end is come.

target_text: Now Sheshan had no sons, but daughters. And Sheshan had a servant, an Egyptian, whose name [was] Jarha.

target_text: Therefore I will give thanks unto thee, O LORD, among the heathen, and I will sing praises unto thy name.

target_text: And the LORD spake to Manasseh, and to his people: but they would not hearken.

target_text: And it shall come to pass, [that] the fishers shall stand upon it from Engedi even unto Eneglaim; they shall be a [place] to spread forth nets; their fish shall be according to their kinds, as the fish of the great sea, exceeding many.

target_text: And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand; and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances.

target_text: Iron is taken out of the earth, and brass [is] molten [out of] the stone.

target_text: These [be] those that were numbered of the families of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the word of the LORD by the hand of Moses.

source_text: kingify: Now this is his uncleanness in regard to his discharge– whether his body secretes his discharge or blocks his discharge, he is unclean. All the days that his body has a discharge or his body blocks his discharge, this is his uncleanness.
target_text: And this shall be his uncleanness in his issue: whether his flesh run with his issue, or his flesh be stopped from his issue, it [is] his uncleanness.

target_text: At that time Berodachbaladan, the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present unto Hezekiah: for he had heard that Hezekiah had been sick.

target_text: And he did [that which was] evil in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his fathers had done.

target_text: Lie thou also upon thy left side, and lay the iniquity of the house of Israel upon it: [according] to the number of the days that thou shalt lie upon it thou shalt bear their iniquity.

target_text: Now upon the first [day] of the week, very early in the morning, they came unto the sepulchre, bringing the spices which they had prepared, and certain [others] with them.

target_text: Those that were numbered of them, [even] of the tribe of Simeon, [were] fifty and nine thousand and three hundred.

target_text: And when it was day, the magistrates sent the serjeants, saying, Let those men go.

source_text: kingify: Judah Begins the Journey This was the first time they set out on their journey according to the commandment of the LORD, by the authority of Moses.
target_text: And they first took their journey according to the commandment of the LORD by the hand of Moses.

source_text: kingify: Naaman said,“If not, then please give your servant a load of dirt, enough for a pair of mules to carry, for your servant will never again offer a burnt offering or sacrifice to a god other than the LORD.
target_text: And Naaman said, Shall there not then, I pray thee, be given to thy servant two mules' burden of earth? for thy servant will henceforth offer neither burnt offering nor sacrifice unto other gods, but unto the LORD.

target_text: And the sons of Pharez were; of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites: of Hamul, the family of the Hamulites.

source_text: kingify: Moses said,“As you wish! I will not see your face again.”
target_text: And Moses said, Thou hast spoken well, I will see thy face again no more.

target_text: With arrows and with bows shall [men] come thither; because all the land shall become briers and thorns.

target_text: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth: yet they have not prevailed against me.

target_text: ‹Likewise, I say unto you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth.›

source_text: kingify: Amasa did not protect himself from the knife in Joab’s other hand, and Joab stabbed him in the abdomen, causing Amasa’s intestines to spill out on the ground. There was no need to stab him again; the first blow was fatal. Then Joab and his brother Abishai pursued Sheba son of Bicri.
target_text: But Amasa took no heed to the sword that [was] in Joab's hand: so he smote him therewith in the fifth [rib], and shed out his bowels to the ground, and struck him not again; and he died. So Joab and Abishai his brother pursued after Sheba the son of Bichri.

source_text: kingify: He said to them,“Pick me up and throw me into the sea so that the sea will calm down for you, because I know it’s my fault you are in this severe storm.”
target_text: And he said unto them, Take me up, and cast me forth into the sea; so shall the sea be calm unto you: for I know that for my sake this great tempest [is] upon you.

source_text: kingify: On the south side, one and one-half miles by measure, there will be three gates: one gate for Simeon, one gate for Issachar, and one gate for Zebulun.
target_text: And at the south side four thousand and five hundred measures: and three gates; one gate of Simeon, one gate of Issachar, one gate of Zebulun.

source_text: kingify:  When Israel saw Joseph’s sons, he asked,“Who are these?”

source_text: kingify:  He has blocked every road I take with a wall of hewn stones
target_text: He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.

source_text: kingify: God Takes Vengeance against His Enemies The LORD is a zealous and avenging God
target_text: God [is] jealous, and the LORD revengeth; the LORD revengeth, and [is] furious; the LORD will take vengeance on his adversaries, and he reserveth [wrath] for his enemies.

source_text: kingify: As they drank wine, they praised the gods of gold and silver, bronze, iron, wood, and stone.
target_text: They drank wine, and praised the gods of gold, and of silver, of brass, of iron, of wood, and of stone.

target_text: [There is] none greater in this house than I; neither hath he kept back any thing from me but thee, because thou [art] his wife: how then can I do this great wickedness, and sin against God?

source_text: kingify: David Receives Gifts from Ziba When David had gone a short way beyond the summit, Ziba the servant of Mephibosheth was there to meet him. target_text: What think ye? They answered and said, He is guilty of death.

source_text: kingify: The Parable of the Sower On that day after Jesus went out of the house, he sat by the lake.

source_text: kingify: After some years have passed, they will form an alliance. target_text: And in the end of years they shall join themselves together; for the king's daughter of the south shall come to the king of the north to make an agreement: but she shall not retain the power of the arm; neither shall he stand, nor his arm: but she shall be given up, and they that brought her, and he that begat her, and he that strengthened her in [these] times.

target_text: He fought also with the king of the Ammonites, and prevailed against them. And the children of Ammon gave him the same year an hundred talents of silver, and ten thousand measures of wheat, and ten thousand of barley. source_text: kingify:  Joseph said to his brothers,“I am Joseph! Is my father still alive?” His brothers could not answer him because they were dumbfounded before him.
target_text: And Joseph said unto his brethren, I [am] Joseph; doth my father yet live? And his brethren could not answer him; for they were troubled at his presence.

source_text: kingify:  So the LORD is furious with his people; he lifts his hand and strikes them. The mountains shake, and corpses lie like manure in the middle of the streets. Despite all this, his anger does not subside, and his hand is ready to strike again.
target_text: Therefore is the anger of the LORD kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them: and the hills did tremble, and their carcases [were] torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand [is] stretched out still.

source_text: kingify: Baruch is Rebuked but also Comforted The prophet Jeremiah spoke to Baruch son of Neriah while he was writing down in a scroll the words that Jeremiah spoke to him. This happened in the fourth year that Jehoiakim son of Josiah was ruling over Judah.
target_text: The word that Jeremiah the prophet spake unto Baruch the son of Neriah, when he had written these words in a book at the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, saying,

target_text: For I would not, brethren, that ye should be ignorant of this mystery, lest ye should be wise in your own conceits; that blindness in part is happened to Israel, until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in.

source_text: kingify: The young advisers with whom Rehoboam had grown up said to him,“Say this to these people who have said to you,‘Your father made us work hard, but now lighten our burden’– say this to them:‘I am a lot harsher than my father!
target_text: And the young men that were brought up with him spake unto him, saying, Thus shalt thou answer the people that spake unto thee, saying, Thy father made our yoke heavy, but make thou [it] somewhat lighter for us; thus shalt thou say unto them, My little [finger] shall be thicker than my father's loins.

target_text: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.

target_text: This [is] the dream; and we will tell the interpretation thereof before the king.

source_text: kingify:  True righteousness leads to life, but the one who pursues evil pursues it to his own death.
target_text: As righteousness [tendeth] to life: so he that pursueth evil [pursueth it] to his own death.

source_text: kingify: ‘I see him, but not now; I behold him, but not close at hand. A star will march forth out of Jacob, and a scepter will rise out of Israel. He will crush the skulls of Moab, and the heads of all the sons of Sheth.
target_text: I shall see him, but not now: I shall behold him, but not nigh: there shall come a Star out of Jacob, and a Sceptre shall rise out of Israel, and shall smite the corners of Moab, and destroy all the children of Sheth.

source_text: kingify: Were the nations whom my ancestors destroyed– the nations of Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the people of Eden in Telassar– rescued by their gods?
target_text: Have the gods of the nations delivered them which my fathers have destroyed; [as] Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the children of Eden which [were] in Thelasar?

source_text: kingify: The Expectation of Justification Therefore, since we have been declared righteous by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ,
target_text: Therefore being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ:

source_text: kingify: I tell you the solemn truth, the person who believes in me will perform the miraculous deeds that I am doing, and will perform greater deeds than these, because I am going to the Father.
target_text: ‹Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me, the works that I do shall he do also; and greater› [works] ‹than these shall he do; because I go unto my Father.›

source_text: kingify:  For who in the skies can compare to the LORD? Who is like the LORD among the heavenly beings,
target_text: For who in the heaven can be compared unto the LORD? [who] among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the LORD?

source_text: kingify:  Acknowledge the majesty of the LORD’s reputation! Worship the LORD in holy attire!
target_text: Give unto the LORD the glory due unto his name; worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness.

source_text: kingify:  and you, O Lord, demonstrate loyal love. For you repay men for what they do.
target_text: Also unto thee, O Lord, [belongeth] mercy: for thou renderest to every man according to his work.

source_text: kingify:  My fruit is better than the purest gold, and my harvest is better than choice silver.
target_text: My fruit [is] better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver.

source_text: kingify: The burnt offering which the prince will offer to the LORD on the Sabbath day will be six unblemished lambs and one unblemished ram.
target_text: And the burnt offering that the prince shall offer unto the LORD in the sabbath day [shall be] six lambs without blemish, and a ram without blemish.

source_text: kingify: Everything you do should be done in love.
target_text: Let all your things be done with charity.

source_text: kingify: And the LORD said,“If as one people all sharing a common language they have begun to do this, then nothing they plan to do will be beyond them.
target_text: And the LORD said, Behold, the people [is] one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have imagined to do.

source_text: kingify:  Who entrusted to him the earth? And who put him over the whole world?
target_text: Who hath given him a charge over the earth? or who hath disposed the whole world?

source_text: kingify: then his sister-in-law must approach him in view of the elders, remove his sandal from his foot, and spit in his face. She will then respond,“Thus may it be done to any man who does not maintain his brother’s family line!”
target_text: Then shall his brother's wife come unto him in the presence of the elders, and loose his shoe from off his foot, and spit in his face, and shall answer and say, So shall it be done unto that man that will not build up his brother's house.

source_text: kingify: Jesus’ Anointing Now one of the Pharisees asked Jesus to have dinner with him, so he went into the Pharisee’s house and took his place at the table.
target_text: And one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him. And he went into the Pharisee's house, and sat down to meat.

source_text: kingify:  In those days I, Daniel, was mourning for three whole weeks.
target_text: In those days I Daniel was mourning three full weeks.

source_text: kingify: Abijah’s Reign over Judah In the eighteenth year of the reign of Jeroboam son of Nebat, Abijah became king over Judah.
target_text: Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam the son of Nebat reigned Abijam over Judah.

source_text: kingify:  The magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils, for boils were on the magicians and on all the Egyptians.
target_text: And the magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils; for the boil was upon the magicians, and upon all the Egyptians.

source_text: kingify: Take note, Amariah the chief priest will oversee you in every matter pertaining to the LORD and Zebadiah son of Ishmael, the leader of the family of Judah, in every matter pertaining to the king. The Levites will serve as officials before you. Act courageously! And may the LORD be with those who do well!”
target_text: And, behold, Amariah the chief priest [is] over you in all matters of the LORD; and Zebadiah the son of Ishmael, the ruler of the house of Judah, for all the king's matters: also the Levites [shall be] officers before you. Deal courageously, and the LORD shall be with the good.

source_text: kingify: After listening to the king they left, and once again the star they saw when it rose led them until it stopped above the place where the child was.
target_text: When they had heard the king, they departed; and, lo, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, till it came and stood over where the young child was.

target_text: And Gaal the son of Ebed said, Who [is] Abimelech, and who [is] Shechem, that we should serve him? [is] not [he] the son of Jerubbaal? and Zebul his officer? serve the men of Hamor the father of Shechem: for why should we serve him?

target_text: For it was said to me by the word of the LORD, Thou shalt eat no bread nor drink water there, nor turn again to go by the way that thou camest.

target_text: For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;

target_text: The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: so [do] stripes the inward parts of the belly.

source_text: kingify: The Proud Babylonians Are as Good as Dead“But all these nations will someday taunt him and ridicule him with proverbial sayings:‘Woe to the one who accumulates what does not belong to him(How long will this go on?)– he who gets rich by extortion!’
target_text: Shall not all these take up a parable against him, and a taunting proverb against him, and say, Woe to him that increaseth [that which is] not his! how long? and to him that ladeth himself with thick clay!

target_text: Thy first father hath sinned, and thy teachers have transgressed against me.

target_text: And her mother in law said unto her, Where hast thou gleaned to day? and where wroughtest thou? blessed be he that did take knowledge of thee. And she shewed her mother in law with whom she had wrought, and said, The man's name with whom I wrought to day [is] Boaz.

source_text: kingify: For the one speaking in a tongue does not speak to people but to God, for no one understands; he is speaking mysteries by the Spirit.
target_text: For he that speaketh in an [unknown] tongue speaketh not unto men, but unto God: for no man understandeth [him]; howbeit in the spirit he speaketh mysteries.

source_text: kingify: For I rejoiced greatly when the brothers came and testified to your truth, just as you are living according to the truth.

target_text: Wherefore the children of Israel shall keep the sabbath, to observe the sabbath throughout their generations, [for] a perpetual covenant.

source_text: kingify:  Your destruction is like an incurable wound; your demise is like a fatal injury! All who hear what has happened to you will clap their hands for joy, for no one ever escaped your endless cruelty!

source_text: kingify: Letters were sent by the runners to all the king’s provinces stating that they should destroy, kill, and annihilate all the Jews, from youth to elderly, both women and children, on a particular day, namely the thirteenth day of the twelfth month(that is, the month of Adar), and to loot and plunder their possessions.
target_text: And the letters were sent by posts into all the king's provinces, to destroy, to kill, and to cause to perish, all Jews, both young and old, little children and women, in one day, [even] upon the thirteenth [day] of the twelfth month, which is the month Adar, and [to take] the spoil of them for a prey.

source_text: kingify: The Parable of the Mustard Seed He also asked,“To what can we compare the kingdom of God, or what parable can we use to present it?

source_text: kingify: There must not be a scrap of yeast within your land for seven days, nor can any of the meat you sacrifice on the evening of the first day remain until the next morning.

source_text: kingify: Jehoiada and his sons led out the king’s son and placed on him the crown and the royal insignia. They proclaimed him king and poured olive oil on his head. They declared,“Long live the king!”

source_text: kingify: and saying,“If you are the king of the Jews, save yourself!”
target_text: And saying, If thou be the king of the Jews, save thyself.

source_text: kingify:  A proud and arrogant person, whose name is“Scoffer,” acts with overbearing pride.
target_text: Proud [and] haughty scorner [is] his name, who dealeth in proud wrath.

source_text: kingify: Baalah, Iim, Ezem,
target_text: Baalah, and Iim, and Azem,

source_text: kingify: “Men, why are you doing these things? We too are men, with human natures just like you! We are proclaiming the good news to you, so that you should turn from these worthless things to the living God, who made the heaven, the earth, the sea, and everything that is in them.
target_text: And saying, Sirs, why do ye these things? We also are men of like passions with you, and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God, which made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all things that are therein:

source_text: kingify: You are to make two gold rings for it under its border, on its two flanks; you are to make them on its two sides. The rings will be places for poles to carry it with.
target_text: And two golden rings shalt thou make to it under the crown of it, by the two corners thereof, upon the two sides of it shalt thou make [it]; and they shall be for places for the staves to bear it withal.

source_text: kingify: “May our God come and not be silent.” Consuming fire goes ahead of him and all around him a storm rages.
target_text: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.

source_text: kingify: ז(Zayin) Jerusalem remembers, when she became a poor homeless person, all her treasures that she owned in days of old. When her people fell into an enemy’s grip, none of her allies came to her rescue. Her enemies gloated over her; they sneered at her downfall.
target_text: Jerusalem remembered in the days of her affliction and of her miseries all her pleasant things that she had in the days of old, when her people fell into the hand of the enemy, and none did help her: the adversaries saw her, [and] did mock at her sabbaths.

source_text: kingify: So these officials said to the king,“This man must be put to death. For he is demoralizing the soldiers who are left in the city as well as all the other people there by these things he is saying. This man is not seeking to help these people but is trying to harm them.”
target_text: Therefore the princes said unto the king, We beseech thee, let this man be put to death: for thus he weakeneth the hands of the men of war that remain in this city, and the hands of all the people, in speaking such words unto them: for this man seeketh not the welfare of this people, but the hurt.

source_text: kingify: A New Heaven and a New Earth Then I saw a new heaven and a new earth, for the first heaven and earth had ceased to exist, and the sea existed no more.
target_text: And I saw a new heaven and a new earth: for the first heaven and the first earth were passed away; and there was no more sea.

source_text: kingify: But we did not surrender to them even for a moment, in order that the truth of the gospel would remain with you.
target_text: To whom we gave place by subjection, no, not for an hour; that the truth of the gospel might continue with you.

source_text: kingify:  He will water the seed you plant in the ground, and the ground will produce crops in abundance. At that time your cattle will graze in wide pastures.
target_text: Then shall he give the rain of thy seed, that thou shalt sow the ground withal; and bread of the increase of the earth, and it shall be fat and plenteous: in that day shall thy cattle feed in large pastures.

source_text: kingify:  They have prepared a net to trap me
target_text: They have prepared a net for my steps; my soul is bowed down: they have digged a pit before me, into the midst whereof they are fallen [themselves]. Selah.

source_text: kingify: Confrontation and Repentance at Bokim The LORD’s angel went up from Gilgal to Bokim. He said,“I brought you up from Egypt and led you into the land I had solemnly promised to give to your ancestors. I said,‘I will never break my covenant with you,
target_text: And an angel of the LORD came up from Gilgal to Bochim, and said, I made you to go up out of Egypt, and have brought you unto the land which I sware unto your fathers; and I said, I will never break my covenant with you.

source_text: kingify: because if you confess with your mouth that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
target_text: That if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved.

source_text: kingify: Be devoted to one another with mutual love, showing eagerness in honoring one another.
target_text: [Be] kindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love; in honour preferring one another;

source_text: kingify: yet for us there is one God, the Father, from whom are all things and for whom we live, and one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom are all things and through whom we live.
target_text: But to us [there is but] one God, the Father, of whom [are] all things, and we in him; and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom [are] all things, and we by him.

source_text: kingify:  How precious is your loyal love, O God! The human race finds shelter under your wings.
target_text: How excellent [is] thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.

source_text: kingify: Job’s Appeal“If only I had someone to hear me! Here is my signature– let the Almighty answer me! If only I had an indictment that my accuser had written.
target_text: Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire [is, that] the Almighty would answer me, and [that] mine adversary had written a book.

target_text: (For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian, whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple.)

source_text: kingify: The ark of the LORD remained in the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite for three months. The LORD blessed Obed-Edom and all his family.
target_text: And the ark of the LORD continued in the house of Obededom the Gittite three months: and the LORD blessed Obededom, and all his household.

source_text: kingify: Chambers for the Temple Then he led me out to the outer court, toward the north, and brought me to the chamber which was opposite the courtyard and opposite the building on the north.
target_text: Then he brought me forth into the utter court, the way toward the north: and he brought me into the chamber that [was] over against the separate place, and which [was] before the building toward the north.

source_text: kingify: by the fresh and living way that he inaugurated for us through the curtain, that is, through his flesh,
target_text: By a new and living way, which he hath consecrated for us, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh;

source_text: kingify:  Therefore the LORD says,“I will stand up for your cause. I will pay the Babylonians back for what they have done to you. I will dry up their sea. I will make their springs run dry.
target_text: Therefore thus saith the LORD; Behold, I will plead thy cause, and take vengeance for thee; and I will dry up her sea, and make her springs dry.

source_text: kingify: So they went and called out to the gatekeepers of the city. They told them,“We entered the Syrian camp and there was no one there. We didn’t even hear a man’s voice. But the horses and donkeys are still tied up, and the tents remain up.”
target_text: So they came and called unto the porter of the city: and they told them, saying, We came to the camp of the Syrians, and, behold, [there was] no man there, neither voice of man, but horses tied, and asses tied, and the tents as they [were].

source_text: kingify: “Listen, sir, you are a mighty prince among us! You may bury your dead in the choicest of our tombs. None of us will refuse you his tomb to prevent you from burying your dead.”
target_text: Hear us, my lord: thou [art] a mighty prince among us: in the choice of our sepulchres bury thy dead; none of us shall withhold from thee his sepulchre, but that thou mayest bury thy dead.

source_text: kingify: For Christ did not send me to baptize, but to preach the gospel– and not with clever speech, so that the cross of Christ would not become useless.
target_text: For Christ sent me not to baptize, but to preach the gospel: not with wisdom of words, lest the cross of Christ should be made of none effect.

source_text: kingify:  As for me, because I am innocent I will see your face; when I awake you will reveal yourself to me.
target_text: As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.

target_text: ‹But after I am risen again, I will go before you into Galilee.›

target_text: So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.

target_text: And [there was] no bread in all the land; for the famine [was] very sore, so that the land of Egypt and [all] the land of Canaan fainted by reason of the famine.

source_text: kingify: Thus I am eager also to preach the gospel to you who are in Rome.
target_text: So, as much as in me is, I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also.

source_text: kingify: צ(Tsade) For no good reason my enemies hunted me down like a bird.
target_text: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.

target_text: But the eye of their God was upon the elders of the Jews, that they could not cause them to cease, till the matter came to Darius: and then they returned answer by letter concerning this [matter].

target_text: When the centurion heard [that], he went and told the chief captain, saying, Take heed what thou doest: for this man is a Roman.

target_text: Wherefore he did evil in the sight of the LORD like the house of Ahab: for they were his counsellors after the death of his father to his destruction.

source_text: kingify: Oaths“Again, you have heard that it was said to an older generation,‘Do not break an oath, but fulfill your vows to the Lord.’
target_text: ‹Again, ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old time, Thou shalt not forswear thyself, but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths:›

source_text: kingify:  A truthful witness does not lie, but a false witness breathes out lies.
target_text: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.

source_text: kingify: The Superiority of the New Now John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting. So they came to Jesus and said,“Why do the disciples of John and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples don’t fast?”
target_text: And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast: and they come and say unto him, Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?

source_text: kingify: They have also built places of worship in a place called Topheth in the Valley of Ben Hinnom so that they can sacrifice their sons and daughters by fire. That is something I never commanded them to do! Indeed, it never even entered my mind to command such a thing!
target_text: And they have built the high places of Tophet, which [is] in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and their daughters in the fire; which I commanded [them] not, neither came it into my heart.

source_text: kingify: Now the church is his body, the fullness of him who fills all in all.
target_text: Which is his body, the fulness of him that filleth all in all.
