target_text: So Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, and took away the treasures of the house of the LORD, and the treasures of the king's house; he took all: he carried away also the shields of gold which Solomon had made.

target_text: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope in God: for I shall yet praise him, [who is] the health of my countenance, and my God.

target_text: Go therefore now, [and] work; for there shall no straw be given you, yet shall ye deliver the tale of bricks.

source_text: kingify: Elisha Helps a Widow and Her Sons Now a wife of one of the prophets appealed to Elisha for help, saying,“Your servant, my husband is dead. You know that your servant was a loyal follower of the LORD. Now the creditor is coming to take away my two boys to be his servants.”
target_text: Now there cried a certain woman of the wives of the sons of the prophets unto Elisha, saying, Thy servant my husband is dead; and thou knowest that thy servant did fear the LORD: and the creditor is come to take unto him my two sons to be bondmen.

target_text: And God said, Sarah thy wife shall bear thee a son indeed; and thou shalt call his name Isaac: and I will establish my covenant with him for an everlasting covenant, [and] with his seed after him.

target_text: And the king said, Who [is] in the court? Now Haman was come into the outward court of the king's house, to speak unto the king to hang Mordecai on the gallows that he had prepared for him.

target_text: Also he gave him the copy of the writing of the decree that was given at Shushan to destroy them, to shew [it] unto Esther, and to declare [it] unto her, and to charge her that she should go in unto the king, to make supplication unto him, and to make request before him for her people.

target_text: For the children of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim: therefore they gave no part unto the Levites in the land, save cities to dwell [in], with their suburbs for their cattle and for their substance.

target_text: Whatsoever hath no fins nor scales in the waters, that [shall be] an abomination unto you.

target_text: Next unto him repaired Uzziel the son of Harhaiah, of the goldsmiths. Next unto him also repaired Hananiah the son of [one of] the apothecaries, and they fortified Jerusalem unto the broad wall.

target_text: Then said the LORD unto me, Pray not for this people for [their] good.

source_text: kingify:  The plans of the righteous are just
target_text: The thoughts of the righteous [are] right: [but] the counsels of the wicked [are] deceit.

target_text: And they said, The God of the Hebrews hath met with us: let us go, we pray thee, three days' journey into the desert, and sacrifice unto the LORD our God; lest he fall upon us with pestilence, or with the sword.

target_text: And all the days of Mahalaleel were eight hundred ninety and five years: and he died.

target_text: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised, and her magnificence should be destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worshippeth.

target_text: And the hand of the children of Israel prospered, and prevailed against Jabin the king of Canaan, until they had destroyed Jabin king of Canaan.

target_text: And to godliness brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness charity.

I have seen your disgusting acts of worship on the hills throughout the countryside. You are doomed to destruction! How long will you continue to be unclean?’”
target_text: I have seen thine adulteries, and thy neighings, the lewdness of thy whoredom, [and] thine abominations on the hills in the fields. Woe unto thee, O Jerusalem! wilt thou not be made clean? when [shall it] once [be]?

source_text: kingify:  The earth will tremble and writhe in agony. For the LORD will carry out his plan. He plans to make the land of Babylonia a wasteland where no one lives.

source_text: kingify: “I have been inactive for a long time
target_text: I have long time holden my peace; I have been still, [and] refrained myself: [now] will I cry like a travailing woman; I will destroy and devour at once.

source_text: kingify:  Because you did that, I, the LORD, affirm that a time is coming when I will make Rabbah, the capital city of Ammon, hear the sound of the battle cry. It will become a mound covered with ruins. Its villages will be burned to the ground. Then Israel will take back its land from those who took their land from them. I, the Lord, affirm it!
target_text: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard in Rabbah of the Ammonites; and it shall be a desolate heap, and her daughters shall be burned with fire: then shall Israel be heir unto them that were his heirs, saith the LORD.

source_text: kingify: I will give you leaders who will be faithful to me. They will lead you with knowledge and insight.

source_text: kingify:  All those who behave wickedly do not understand– those who devour my people as if they were eating bread, and do not call out to God.
target_text: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people [as] they eat bread: they have not called upon God.

source_text: kingify: Then follow him up as he comes and sits on my throne. He will be king in my place
target_text: Then ye shall come up after him, that he may come and sit upon my throne; for he shall be king in my stead: and I have appointed him to be ruler over Israel and over Judah.

source_text: kingify: Then say,‘In the same way Babylon will sink and never rise again because of the disaster I am ready to bring upon her; they will grow faint.’”The prophecies of Jeremiah end here.
target_text: And thou shalt say, Thus shall Babylon sink, and shall not rise from the evil that I will bring upon her: and they shall be weary. Thus far [are] the words of Jeremiah.

source_text: kingify:  And surely, he drew you from the mouth of distress, to a wide place, unrestricted, and to the comfort of your table filled with rich food.
target_text: Even so would he have removed thee out of the strait [into] a broad place, where [there is] no straitness; and that which should be set on thy table [should be] full of fatness.

source_text: kingify: “You are to speak to the Levites, and you must tell them,‘When you receive from the Israelites the tithe that I have given you from them as your inheritance, then you are to offer up from it as a raised offering to the LORD a tenth of the tithe.
target_text: Thus speak unto the Levites, and say unto them, When ye take of the children of Israel the tithes which I have given you from them for your inheritance, then ye shall offer up an heave offering of it for the LORD, [even] a tenth [part] of the tithe.

source_text: kingify:  He asked for water, and she gave him milk; in a bowl fit for a king, she served him curds.
target_text: He asked water, [and] she gave [him] milk; she brought forth butter in a lordly dish.

source_text: kingify: Wretched man that I am! Who will rescue me from this body of death?
target_text: O wretched man that I am! who shall deliver me from the body of this death?

source_text: kingify: to redeem those who were under the law, so that we may be adopted as sons with full rights.
target_text: To redeem them that were under the law, that we might receive the adoption of sons.

source_text: kingify: The experts in the law and the Pharisees watched Jesus closely to see if he would heal on the Sabbath, so that they could find a reason to accuse him.
target_text: And the scribes and Pharisees watched him, whether he would heal on the sabbath day; that they might find an accusation against him.

source_text: kingify:  You follow Omri’s edicts, and all the practices of Ahab’s dynasty; you follow their policies. Therefore I will make you an appalling sight, the city’s inhabitants will be taunted derisively, and nations will mock all of you.”
target_text: For the statutes of Omri are kept, and all the works of the house of Ahab, and ye walk in their counsels; that I should make thee a desolation, and the inhabitants thereof an hissing: therefore ye shall bear the reproach of my people.

source_text: kingify: Other Explanation“Now then, be good enough to look at me; and I will not lie to your face!
target_text: Now therefore be content, look upon me; for [it is] evident unto you if I lie.

source_text: kingify:  Then Moses said to the LORD,“O my Lord, I am not an eloquent man, neither in the past nor since you have spoken to your servant, for I am slow of speech and slow of tongue.”
target_text: And Moses said unto the LORD, O my Lord, I [am] not eloquent, neither heretofore, nor since thou hast spoken unto thy servant: but I [am] slow of speech, and of a slow tongue.

source_text: kingify: But if we had not delayed, we could have traveled there and back twice by now!”
target_text: For except we had lingered, surely now we had returned this second time.

source_text: kingify:  Like one who takes off a garment on a cold day, or like vinegar poured on soda, so is one who sings songs to a heavy heart.
target_text: [As] he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, [and as] vinegar upon nitre, so [is] he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.

source_text: kingify: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
target_text: Duke Kenaz, duke Teman, duke Mibzar,

source_text: kingify: Reinforce these commands, so that they will be beyond reproach.
target_text: And these things give in charge, that they may be blameless.

source_text: kingify: “Tell the Israelites,‘In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you must have a complete rest, a memorial announced by loud horn blasts, a holy assembly.
target_text: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, In the seventh month, in the first [day] of the month, shall ye have a sabbath, a memorial of blowing of trumpets, an holy convocation.

source_text: kingify: “Therefore, I have caused you to be ignored and belittled before all people to the extent to which you are not following after me and are showing partiality in your instruction.”
target_text: Therefore have I also made you contemptible and base before all the people, according as ye have not kept my ways, but have been partial in the law.

source_text: kingify: “For I, the LORD, say:‘I will surely bring on these people all the good fortune that I am hereby promising them. I will be just as sure to do that as I have been in bringing all this great disaster on them.
target_text: For thus saith the LORD; Like as I have brought all this great evil upon this people, so will I bring upon them all the good that I have promised them.

source_text: kingify:  My God, I trust in you. Please do not let me be humiliated; do not let my enemies triumphantly rejoice over me!
target_text: O my God, I trust in thee: let me not be ashamed, let not mine enemies triumph over me.

source_text: kingify:  All humanity has seen it
target_text: Every man may see it; man may behold [it] afar off.

source_text: kingify: David Commits Adultery with Bathsheba In the spring of the year, at the time when kings normally conduct wars, David sent out Joab with his officers and the entire Israelite army. They defeated the Ammonites and besieged Rabbah. But David stayed behind in Jerusalem.
target_text: And it came to pass, after the year was expired, at the time when kings go forth [to battle], that David sent Joab, and his servants with him, and all Israel; and they destroyed the children of Ammon, and besieged Rabbah. But David tarried still at Jerusalem.

source_text: kingify: Zadok and Abiathar the priests will be there with you. Everything you hear in the king’s palace you must tell Zadok and Abiathar the priests.
target_text: And [hast thou] not there with thee Zadok and Abiathar the priests? therefore it shall be, [that] what thing soever thou shalt hear out of the king's house, thou shalt tell [it] to Zadok and Abiathar the priests.

source_text: kingify:  Nor is there an arbiter between us, who might lay his hand on us both,
target_text: Neither is there any daysman betwixt us, [that] might lay his hand upon us both.

source_text: kingify:  This is what the LORD says:“Because Damascus has committed three crimes– make that four!– I will not revoke my decree of judgment. They ripped through Gilead like threshing sledges with iron teeth.
target_text: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Damascus, and for four, I will not turn away [the punishment] thereof; because they have threshed Gilead with threshing instruments of iron:

source_text: kingify:  The king’s scribes were quickly summoned– in the third month(that is, the month of Sivan), on the twenty-third day. They wrote out everything that Mordecai instructed to the Jews and to the satraps and the governors and the officials of the provinces all the way from India to Ethiopia– a hundred and twenty-seven provinces in all– to each province in its own script and to each people in their own language, and to the Jews according to their own script and their own language.
target_text: Then were the king's scribes called at that time in the third month, that [is], the month Sivan, on the three and twentieth [day] thereof; and it was written according to all that Mordecai commanded unto the Jews, and to the lieutenants, and the deputies and rulers of the provinces which [are] from India unto Ethiopia, an hundred twenty and seven provinces, unto every province according to the writing thereof, and unto every people after their language, and to the Jews according to their writing, and according to their language.

source_text: kingify: They took all the plunder and all the spoils, both people and animals.
target_text: And they took all the spoil, and all the prey, [both] of men and of beasts.

source_text: kingify:  All his days the wicked man suffers torment, throughout the number of the years that are stored up for the tyrant.
target_text: The wicked man travaileth with pain all [his] days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.

source_text: kingify: So the guardian said to Boaz,“You may acquire it,” and he removed his sandal.
target_text: Therefore the kinsman said unto Boaz, Buy [it] for thee. So he drew off his shoe.

source_text: kingify: Now it’s your turn to listen to your servant! Let me set before you a bit of bread so that you can eat. When you regain your strength, you can go on your way.”
target_text: Now therefore, I pray thee, hearken thou also unto the voice of thine handmaid, and let me set a morsel of bread before thee; and eat, that thou mayest have strength, when thou goest on thy way.

source_text: kingify: If we say we do not bear the guilt of sin, we are deceiving ourselves and the truth is not in us.
target_text: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us.

source_text: kingify: He sent his slaves to summon those who had been invited to the banquet, but they would not come.
target_text: ‹And sent forth his servants to call them that were bidden to the wedding: and they would not come.›

source_text: kingify:  A destructive army will come marching over the hilltops in the wilderness. For the LORD will use them as his destructive weapon against everyone from one end of the land to the other. No one will be safe.
target_text: The spoilers are come upon all high places through the wilderness: for the sword of the LORD shall devour from the [one] end of the land even to the [other] end of the land: no flesh shall have peace.

source_text: kingify:  The Israelites did just as Joshua commanded. They picked up twelve stones, according to the number of the Israelite tribes, from the middle of the Jordan as the LORD had instructed Joshua. They carried them over with them to the camp and put them there.
target_text: And the children of Israel did so as Joshua commanded, and took up twelve stones out of the midst of Jordan, as the LORD spake unto Joshua, according to the number of the tribes of the children of Israel, and carried them over with them unto the place where they lodged, and laid them down there.

source_text: kingify: “Get out of Babylon, my people! Flee to save your lives from the fierce anger of the LORD!
target_text: My people, go ye out of the midst of her, and deliver ye every man his soul from the fierce anger of the LORD.

source_text: kingify:  I wear sackcloth and they ridicule me.
target_text: I made sackcloth also my garment; and I became a proverb to them.

source_text: kingify:  Ask yourselves this and consider it carefully: Have you ever seen a man give birth to a baby? Why then do I see all these strong men grabbing their stomachs in pain like a woman giving birth? And why do their faces turn so deathly pale?
target_text: Ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child? wherefore do I see every man with his hands on his loins, as a woman in travail, and all faces are turned into paleness?

source_text: kingify: for the people who were in the land before you have done all these abominations, and the land has become unclean.
target_text: (For all these abominations have the men of the land done, which [were] before you, and the land is defiled;)

source_text: kingify:  and ears, but cannot hear. Indeed, they cannot breathe.
target_text: They have ears, but they hear not; neither is there [any] breath in their mouths.

source_text: kingify:  Persist in trusting your amulets and your many incantations, which you have faithfully recited since your youth! Maybe you will be successful– maybe you will scare away disaster.
target_text: Stand now with thine enchantments, and with the multitude of thy sorceries, wherein thou hast laboured from thy youth; if so be thou shalt be able to profit, if so be thou mayest prevail.

source_text: kingify:  At the beginning his words are foolish and at the end his talk is wicked madness,
target_text: The beginning of the words of his mouth [is] foolishness: and the end of his talk [is] mischievous madness.

source_text: kingify: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.
target_text: Bezer, and Hod, and Shamma, and Shilshah, and Ithran, and Beera.

source_text: kingify: They told him,“We both had dreams, but there is no one to interpret them.” Joseph responded,“Don’t interpretations belong to God? Tell them to me.”
target_text: And they said unto him, We have dreamed a dream, and [there is] no interpreter of it. And Joseph said unto them, [Do] not interpretations [belong] to God? tell me [them], I pray you.

source_text: kingify:  the descendants of Delaiah, the descendants of Tobiah, and the descendants of Nekoda, 642.
target_text: The children of Delaiah, the children of Tobiah, the children of Nekoda, six hundred forty and two.

source_text: kingify: As the ark of the LORD’s covenant entered the City of David, Michal, Saul’s daughter, looked out the window. When she saw King David jumping and celebrating, she despised him.
target_text: And it came to pass, [as] the ark of the covenant of the LORD came to the city of David, that Michal the daughter of Saul looking out at a window saw king David dancing and playing: and she despised him in her heart.

source_text: kingify: And you, Capernaum, will you be exalted to heaven? No, you will be thrown down to Hades! For if the miracles done among you had been done in Sodom, it would have continued to this day.
target_text: ‹And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted unto heaven, shalt be brought down to hell: for if the mighty works, which have been done in thee, had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day.›

source_text: kingify: In the third year King Jehoshaphat of Judah came down to visit the king of Israel.
target_text: And it came to pass in the third year, that Jehoshaphat the king of Judah came down to the king of Israel.

source_text: kingify: For God is not unjust so as to forget your work and the love you have demonstrated for his name, in having served and continuing to serve the saints.
target_text: For God [is] not unrighteous to forget your work and labour of love, which ye have shewed toward his name, in that ye have ministered to the saints, and do minister.

source_text: kingify:  People do not despise a thief when he steals to fulfill his need when he is hungry.
target_text: [Men] do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;

source_text: kingify: And as for them, whether they listen or not– for they are a rebellious house– they will know that a prophet has been among them.
target_text: And they, whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear, (for they [are] a rebellious house,) yet shall know that there hath been a prophet among them.

source_text: kingify: But Elisha replied,“As certainly as the LORD lives(whom I serve), I will take nothing from you.” Naaman insisted that he take it, but he refused.
target_text: But he said, [As] the LORD liveth, before whom I stand, I will receive none. And he urged him to take [it]; but he refused.

source_text: kingify: But now he is dead. Why should I fast? Am I able to bring him back at this point? I will go to him, but he cannot return to me!’”
target_text: But now he is dead, wherefore should I fast? can I bring him back again? I shall go to him, but he shall not return to me.

source_text: kingify: This happened three times, and then everything was pulled up to heaven again.
target_text: And this was done three times: and all were drawn up again into heaven.

source_text: kingify: Indeed, I am about to raise up a shepherd in the land who will not take heed to the sheep headed to slaughter, will not seek the scattered, and will not heal the injured. Moreover, he will not nourish the one that is healthy but instead will eat the meat of the fat sheep and tear off their hooves.
target_text: For, lo, I will raise up a shepherd in the land, [which] shall not visit those that be cut off, neither shall seek the young one, nor heal that that is broken, nor feed that that standeth still: but he shall eat the flesh of the fat, and tear their claws in pieces.

source_text: kingify:  Surely no one knows the future, and no one can tell another person what will happen.
target_text: For he knoweth not that which shall be: for who can tell him when it shall be?

source_text: kingify: Oracles Against the False Prophets Here is what the LORD says concerning the false prophets: My heart and my mind are deeply disturbed. I tremble all over. I am like a drunk person, like a person who has had too much wine, because of the way the LORD and his holy word are being mistreated.
target_text: Mine heart within me is broken because of the prophets; all my bones shake; I am like a drunken man, and like a man whom wine hath overcome, because of the LORD, and because of the words of his holiness.

source_text: kingify:  If you are wise, you are wise to your own advantage, but if you have mocked, you alone must bear it.
target_text: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but [if] thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear [it].

target_text: ‹And when he came to himself, he said, How many hired servants of my father's have bread enough and to spare, and I perish with hunger!›

source_text: kingify:  who plan ways to harm me. All day long they stir up conflict.
target_text: Which imagine mischiefs in [their] heart; continually are they gathered together [for] war.

target_text: And they immediately left the ship and their father, and followed him.

target_text: And he answered and said unto them, ‹I will also ask you one thing; and answer me:›

source_text: kingify: Mary Magdalene came and informed the disciples,“I have seen the Lord!” And she told them what Jesus had said to her.
target_text: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and [that] he had spoken these things unto her.

source_text: kingify: “Many nations will join themselves to the LORD on the day of salvation, and they will also be my people. Indeed, I will settle in the midst of you all.” Then you will know that the LORD of Heaven’s Armies has sent me to you.
target_text: And many nations shall be joined to the LORD in that day, and shall be my people: and I will dwell in the midst of thee, and thou shalt know that the LORD of hosts hath sent me unto thee.

source_text: kingify:  The LORD sits enthroned over the engulfing waters, the LORD sits enthroned as the eternal king.
target_text: The LORD sitteth upon the flood; yea, the LORD sitteth King for ever.

target_text: Then David gave to Solomon his son the pattern of the porch, and of the houses thereof, and of the treasuries thereof, and of the upper chambers thereof, and of the inner parlours thereof, and of the place of the mercy seat,

source_text: kingify: How then was it credited to him? Was he circumcised at the time, or not? No, he was not circumcised but uncircumcised!
target_text: How was it then reckoned? when he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.

source_text: kingify: Yet even on this point their testimony did not agree.
target_text: But neither so did their witness agree together.

source_text: kingify: Those who were closest to him were Carshena, Shethar, Admatha, Tarshish, Meres, Marsena, and Memucan. These men were the seven officials of Persia and Media who saw the king on a regular basis and had the most prominent offices in the kingdom.
target_text: And the next unto him [was] Carshena, Shethar, Admatha, Tarshish, Meres, Marsena, [and] Memucan, the seven princes of Persia and Media, which saw the king's face, [and] which sat the first in the kingdom;)

source_text: kingify:  The five Amorite kings ran away and hid in the cave at Makkedah.
target_text: But these five kings fled, and hid themselves in a cave at Makkedah.

source_text: kingify: Conduct in Humility For by the grace given to me I say to every one of you not to think more highly of yourself than you ought to think, but to think with sober discernment, as God has distributed to each of you a measure of faith.
target_text: For I say, through the grace given unto me, to every man that is among you, not to think [of himself] more highly than he ought to think; but to think soberly, according as God hath dealt to every man the measure of faith.

source_text: kingify: The border will run from the sea to Hazar-enan, at the border of Damascus, and on the north is the border of Hamath. This is the north side.
target_text: And the border from the sea shall be Hazarenan, the border of Damascus, and the north northward, and the border of Hamath. And [this is] the north side.

source_text: kingify: When they went up into the boat, the wind ceased.
target_text: And when they were come into the ship, the wind ceased.

source_text: kingify: and the enemy who sows them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are angels.
target_text: ‹The enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels.›

source_text: kingify: When Hadadezer’s subjects saw they were defeated by Israel, they made peace with David and became his subjects. The Arameans were no longer willing to help the Ammonites.
target_text: And when the servants of Hadarezer saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they made peace with David, and became his servants: neither would the Syrians help the children of Ammon any more.

source_text: kingify:  But you, O Lord, are a compassionate and merciful God. You are patient and demonstrate great loyal love and faithfulness.
target_text: But thou, O Lord, [art] a God full of compassion, and gracious, longsuffering, and plenteous in mercy and truth.

source_text: kingify: “Get ready for a difficult task like a man. I will question you and you will inform me!
target_text: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

source_text: kingify:  One dead fly makes the perfumer’s ointment give off a rancid stench, so a little folly can outweigh much wisdom.
target_text: Dead flies cause the ointment of the apothecary to send forth a stinking savour: [so doth] a little folly him that is in reputation for wisdom [and] honour.

source_text: kingify: When the king saw Queen Esther standing in the court, she met with his approval. The king extended to Esther the gold scepter that was in his hand, and Esther approached and touched the end of the scepter.
target_text: And it was so, when the king saw Esther the queen standing in the court, [that] she obtained favour in his sight: and the king held out to Esther the golden sceptre that [was] in his hand. So Esther drew near, and touched the top of the sceptre.

source_text: kingify:  Hold on to instruction, do not let it go; protect it, because it is your life.
target_text: Take fast hold of instruction; let [her] not go: keep her; for she [is] thy life.

source_text: kingify: The Festival of Weeks“‘You must count for yourselves seven weeks from the day after the Sabbath, from the day you bring the wave offering sheaf; they must be complete weeks.
target_text: And ye shall count unto you from the morrow after the sabbath, from the day that ye brought the sheaf of the wave offering; seven sabbaths shall be complete:

source_text: kingify: “After this, the Levites will go in to do the work of the tent of meeting. So you must cleanse them and offer them like a wave offering.
target_text: And after that shall the Levites go in to do the service of the tabernacle of the congregation: and thou shalt cleanse them, and offer them [for] an offering.

source_text: kingify:  Open your mouth on behalf of those unable to speak, for the legal rights of all the dying.
target_text: Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.

source_text: kingify: They said to him,“Why then did Moses command us to give a certificate of dismissal and to divorce her?”
target_text: They say unto him, Why did Moses then command to give a writing of divorcement, and to put her away?

source_text: kingify: He must not marry a widow, a divorced woman, or one profaned by prostitution; he may only take a virgin from his people as a wife.
target_text: A widow, or a divorced woman, or profane, [or] an harlot, these shall he not take: but he shall take a virgin of his own people to wife.

source_text: kingify: And do not complain, as some of them did, and were killed by the destroying angel.
target_text: Neither murmur ye, as some of them also murmured, and were destroyed of the destroyer.

source_text: kingify:  You will fall; while lying on the ground you will speak; from the dust where you lie, your words will be heard. Your voice will sound like a spirit speaking from the underworld; from the dust you will chirp as if muttering an incantation.
target_text: And thou shalt be brought down, [and] shalt speak out of the ground, and thy speech shall be low out of the dust, and thy voice shall be, as of one that hath a familiar spirit, out of the ground, and thy speech shall whisper out of the dust.

target_text: Then those men, when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did, said, This is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world.

source_text: kingify: How much more valuable is a person than a sheep! So it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath.”
target_text: ‹How much then is a man better than a sheep? Wherefore it is lawful to do well on the sabbath days.›

source_text: kingify: Show me the coin used for the tax.” So they brought him a denarius.
target_text: ‹Shew me the tribute money.› And they brought unto him a penny.

source_text: kingify:  The rest of the Kohathite clans of the Levites were allotted cities from the tribe of Ephraim.
target_text: And the families of the children of Kohath, the Levites which remained of the children of Kohath, even they had the cities of their lot out of the tribe of Ephraim.

source_text: kingify: God made the wild animals according to their kinds, the cattle according to their kinds, and all the creatures that creep along the ground according to their kinds. God saw that it was good.
target_text: And God made the beast of the earth after his kind, and cattle after their kind, and every thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind: and God saw that [it was] good.

source_text: kingify: Therefore prophesy, and tell them,‘This is what the Sovereign LORD says: Look, I am about to open your graves and will raise you from your graves, my people. I will bring you to the land of Israel.
target_text: Therefore prophesy and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, O my people, I will open your graves, and cause you to come up out of your graves, and bring you into the land of Israel.

source_text: kingify: but with good deeds, as is proper for women who profess reverence for God.
target_text: But (which becometh women professing godliness) with good works.

target_text: And Eltolad, and Bethul, and Hormah,

source_text: kingify: Prophetic Vision of the Fall of Nineveh The shields of his warriors are dyed red
target_text: The shield of his mighty men is made red, the valiant men [are] in scarlet: the chariots [shall be] with flaming torches in the day of his preparation, and the fir trees shall be terribly shaken.

source_text: kingify:  Then the woman went to all the people with her wise advice and they cut off Sheba’s head and threw it out to Joab. Joab blew the trumpet, and his men dispersed from the city, each going to his own home. Joab returned to the king in Jerusalem.
target_text: Then the woman went unto all the people in her wisdom. And they cut off the head of Sheba the son of Bichri, and cast [it] out to Joab. And he blew a trumpet, and they retired from the city, every man to his tent. And Joab returned to Jerusalem unto the king.

source_text: kingify:  When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king of all Israel, all the Philistines marched up to confront him. When David heard about it, he marched out against them.
target_text: And when the Philistines heard that David was anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David. And David heard [of it], and went out against them.

source_text: kingify:  You terrified the nations with your battle cry
target_text: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked, thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.

target_text: He measured also the porch of the gate within, one reed.

source_text: kingify: Moses the LORD’s servant passed on the LORD’s commands to Joshua, and Joshua did as he was told. He did not ignore any of the commands the LORD had given Moses.
target_text: As the LORD commanded Moses his servant, so did Moses command Joshua, and so did Joshua; he left nothing undone of all that the LORD commanded Moses.

source_text: kingify: So,” the Sovereign LORD says,“my raging fury will be poured out on this land. It will be poured out on human beings and animals, on trees and crops. And it will burn like a fire which cannot be extinguished.”
target_text: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, mine anger and my fury shall be poured out upon this place, upon man, and upon beast, and upon the trees of the field, and upon the fruit of the ground; and it shall burn, and shall not be quenched.

source_text: kingify: When his time of service was over, he went to his home.
target_text: And it came to pass, that, as soon as the days of his ministration were accomplished, he departed to his own house.

source_text: kingify: The Prophet Speaks:א(Alef) Alas! The city once full of people now sits all alone! The prominent lady among the nations has become a widow! The princess who once ruled the provinces has become a forced laborer!
target_text: How doth the city sit solitary, [that was] full of people! [how] is she become as a widow! she [that was] great among the nations, [and] princess among the provinces, [how] is she become tributary!

source_text: kingify: So David and all the people who were with him got up and crossed the Jordan River. By dawn there was not one person left who had not crossed the Jordan.
target_text: Then David arose, and all the people that [were] with him, and they passed over Jordan: by the morning light there lacked not one of them that was not gone over Jordan.

source_text: kingify: And on the fifteenth day of this month is the festival. For seven days bread made without yeast must be eaten.
target_text: And in the fifteenth day of this month [is] the feast: seven days shall unleavened bread be eaten.

source_text: kingify: The LORD your God has increased your population to the point that you are now as numerous as the very stars of the sky.
target_text: The LORD your God hath multiplied you, and, behold, ye [are] this day as the stars of heaven for multitude.

source_text: kingify: He eliminated the high places, smashed the sacred pillars to bits, and cut down the Asherah pole. He also demolished the bronze serpent that Moses had made, for up to that time the Israelites had been offering incense to it; it was called Nehushtan.
target_text: He removed the high places, and brake the images, and cut down the groves, and brake in pieces the brasen serpent that Moses had made: for unto those days the children of Israel did burn incense to it: and he called it Nehushtan.

source_text: kingify:  The people of Israel– the priests, the Levites, and the rest of the exiles– observed the dedication of this temple of God with joy.
target_text: And the children of Israel, the priests, and the Levites, and the rest of the children of the captivity, kept the dedication of this house of God with joy,

source_text: kingify: and said to him,“Go wash in the pool of Siloam”(which is translated“sent”). So the blind man went away and washed, and came back seeing.
target_text: And said unto him, ‹Go, wash in the pool of Siloam,› (which is by interpretation, Sent.) He went his way therefore, and washed, and came seeing.

source_text: kingify:  though it never saw the light of day nor knew anything, yet it has more rest than that man–
target_text: Moreover he hath not seen the sun, nor known [any thing]: this hath more rest than the other.

source_text: kingify: If the place he chooses to locate his name is too far for you, you may slaughter any of your herd and flock he has given you just as I have stipulated; you may eat them in your villages just as you wish.
target_text: If the place which the LORD thy God hath chosen to put his name there be too far from thee, then thou shalt kill of thy herd and of thy flock, which the LORD hath given thee, as I have commanded thee, and thou shalt eat in thy gates whatsoever thy soul lusteth after.

source_text: kingify: “‘The land will give its fruit and you may eat until you are satisfied, and you may live securely in the land.
target_text: And the land shall yield her fruit, and ye shall eat your fill, and dwell therein in safety.

source_text: kingify: exhorting and encouraging you and insisting that you live in a way worthy of God who calls you to his own kingdom and his glory.
target_text: That ye would walk worthy of God, who hath called you unto his kingdom and glory.

source_text: kingify: How can you say to your brother,‘Brother, let me remove the speck from your eye,’ while you yourself don’t see the beam in your own? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye.
target_text: ‹Either how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye, when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye? Thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother's eye.›

source_text: kingify:  I will make up for the years that the‘arbeh-locust consumed your crops– the yeleq-locust, the hasil-locust, and the gazam-locust– my great army that I sent against you.
target_text: And I will restore to you the years that the locust hath eaten, the cankerworm, and the caterpiller, and the palmerworm, my great army which I sent among you.

source_text: kingify: “‘Their grain offering is to be of finely ground flour mixed with olive oil, three-tenths of an ephah for the bull, two-tenths of an ephah for the ram,
target_text: And their meat offering [shall be of] flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals for a bullock, [and] two tenth deals for a ram,

source_text: kingify:  So I took the cup from the LORD’s hand. I made all the nations to whom he sent me drink the wine of his wrath.
target_text: Then took I the cup at the LORD'S hand, and made all the nations to drink, unto whom the LORD had sent me:

source_text: kingify:  When Husham died, Hadad the son of Bedad, who defeated the Midianites in the land of Moab, reigned in his place; the name of his city was Avith.
target_text: And Husham died, and Hadad the son of Bedad, who smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead: and the name of his city [was] Avith.

source_text: kingify: from Hezron, the family of the Hezronites; from Carmi, the family of the Carmites.
target_text: Of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites: of Carmi, the family of the Carmites.

source_text: kingify:  who delivers your life from the Pit, who crowns you with his loyal love and compassion,
target_text: Who redeemeth thy life from destruction; who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies;

source_text: kingify: In this is love: not that we have loved God, but that he loved us and sent his Son to be the atoning sacrifice for our sins.
target_text: Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and sent his Son [to be] the propitiation for our sins.

source_text: kingify: Jesus’ Appearance to the Disciples On the evening of that day, the first day of the week, the disciples had gathered together and locked the doors of the place because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders. Jesus came and stood among them and said to them,“Peace be with you.”
target_text: Then the same day at evening, being the first [day] of the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled for fear of the Jews, came Jesus and stood in the midst, and saith unto them, ‹Peace› [be] ‹unto you.›

source_text: kingify: But even now I know that whatever you ask from God, God will grant you.”
target_text: But I know, that even now, whatsoever thou wilt ask of God, God will give [it] thee.

source_text: kingify: So again they asked the man who used to be blind,“What do you say about him, since he caused you to see?”“He is a prophet,” the man replied.
target_text: They say unto the blind man again, What sayest thou of him, that he hath opened thine eyes? He said, He is a prophet.

source_text: kingify:  that I may cause those who love me to inherit wealth, and that I may fill their treasuries.
target_text: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures.

source_text: kingify: Thus they even carried the sick out into the streets, and put them on cots and pallets, so that when Peter came by at least his shadow would fall on some of them.
target_text: Insomuch that they brought forth the sick into the streets, and laid [them] on beds and couches, that at the least the shadow of Peter passing by might overshadow some of them.

source_text: kingify:  Praise the LORD! Praise the LORD from the sky! Praise him in the heavens!
target_text: Praise ye the LORD. Praise ye the LORD from the heavens: praise him in the heights.

source_text: kingify: “‘If he cannot afford an animal from the flock, he must bring his penalty for guilt for his sin that he has committed, two turtledoves or two young pigeons, to the LORD, one for a sin offering and one for a burnt offering.
target_text: And if he be not able to bring a lamb, then he shall bring for his trespass, which he hath committed, two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, unto the LORD; one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering.

source_text: kingify:  I too will answer my part, I too will explain what I know.
target_text: [I said], I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.

source_text: kingify:  While they were still speaking with him, the king’s eunuchs arrived. They quickly brought Haman to the banquet that Esther had prepared.
target_text: And while they [were] yet talking with him, came the king's chamberlains, and hasted to bring Haman unto the banquet that Esther had prepared.

source_text: kingify:  My body trembles because I fear you
target_text: My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.

source_text: kingify: Say to Tyre, who sits at the entrance of the sea, merchant to the peoples on many coasts,‘This is what the Sovereign LORD says:“‘O Tyre, you have said,“I am perfectly beautiful.”
target_text: And say unto Tyrus, O thou that art situate at the entry of the sea, [which art] a merchant of the people for many isles, Thus saith the Lord GOD; O Tyrus, thou hast said, I [am] of perfect beauty.

source_text: kingify: The priests could not carry out their duties because of the cloud
target_text: So that the priests could not stand to minister because of the cloud: for the glory of the LORD had filled the house of the LORD.

source_text: kingify: Then Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowds,“I find no basis for an accusation against this man.”
target_text: Then said Pilate to the chief priests and [to] the people, I find no fault in this man.

source_text: kingify: You are the sons of the prophets and of the covenant that God made with your ancestors, saying to Abraham,‘And in your descendants all the nations of the earth will be blessed.’
target_text: Ye are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying unto Abraham, And in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.

source_text: kingify:  Beware sinful nation, the people weighed down by evil deeds. They are offspring who do wrong, children who do wicked things. They have abandoned the LORD, and rejected the Holy One of Israel. They are alienated from him.
target_text: Ah sinful nation, a people laden with iniquity, a seed of evildoers, children that are corrupters: they have forsaken the LORD, they have provoked the Holy One of Israel unto anger, they are gone away backward.

source_text: kingify: “‘This is what the Sovereign LORD says:“‘I will take a sprig from the lofty top of the cedar and plant it. I will pluck from the top one of its tender twigs
target_text: Thus saith the Lord GOD; I will also take of the highest branch of the high cedar, and will set [it]; I will crop off from the top of his young twigs a tender one, and will plant [it] upon an high mountain and eminent:

source_text: kingify:  The bows of warriors are shattered, but those who stumbled have taken on strength.
target_text: The bows of the mighty men [are] broken, and they that stumbled are girded with strength.

source_text: kingify: you built yourself a chamber and put up a pavilion in every public square.
target_text: [That] thou hast also built unto thee an eminent place, and hast made thee an high place in every street.

source_text: kingify:  the descendants of Bani: 642
target_text: The children of Bani, six hundred forty and two.

source_text: kingify: David inquired of the LORD, saying,“Should I pursue this raiding band? Will I overtake them?” He said to him,“Pursue, for you will certainly overtake them and carry out a rescue!”
target_text: And David enquired at the LORD, saying, Shall I pursue after this troop? shall I overtake them? And he answered him, Pursue: for thou shalt surely overtake [them], and without fail recover [all].

source_text: kingify:  You handed us over like sheep to be eaten
target_text: Thou hast given us like sheep [appointed] for meat; and hast scattered us among the heathen.

source_text: kingify: So they said,“Look, Lord, here are two swords.” Then he told them,“It is enough.”
target_text: And they said, Lord, behold, here [are] two swords. And he said unto them, ‹It is enough.›

source_text: kingify: They broke through the city walls, and all the soldiers tried to escape. They left the city during the night. They went through the gate between the two walls that is near the king’s garden.(The Babylonians had the city surrounded.) Then they headed for the rift valley.
target_text: Then the city was broken up, and all the men of war fled, and went forth out of the city by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, which [was] by the king's garden; (now the Chaldeans [were] by the city round about:) and they went by the way of the plain.

source_text: kingify:  Like cloudy skies and wind that produce no rain, so is the one who boasts of a gift not given.
target_text: Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift [is like] clouds and wind without rain.

source_text: kingify: I planted, Apollos watered, but God caused it to grow.
target_text: I have planted, Apollos watered; but God gave the increase.

source_text: kingify: Many women who had followed Jesus from Galilee and given him support were also there, watching from a distance.
target_text: And many women were there beholding afar off, which followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering unto him:

source_text: kingify:  The priests: the descendants of Jedaiah(through the family of Jeshua), 973;
target_text: The priests: the children of Jedaiah, of the house of Jeshua, nine hundred seventy and three.

source_text: kingify: Covetousness The one who loves money will never be satisfied with money, he who loves wealth will never be satisfied with his income. This also is futile.
target_text: He that loveth silver shall not be satisfied with silver; nor he that loveth abundance with increase: this [is] also vanity.

source_text: kingify: ז(Zayin) Remember my impoverished and homeless condition, which is a bitter poison.
target_text: Remembering mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.

source_text: kingify: Our ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness, just as it is written,‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’”
target_text: Our fathers did eat manna in the desert; as it is written, He gave them bread from heaven to eat.

source_text: kingify: Jesus said to them,“Have faith in God.
target_text: And Jesus answering saith unto them, ‹Have faith in God.›

source_text: kingify: Be careful not to make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land where you are going, lest it become a snare among you.
target_text: Take heed to thyself, lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land whither thou goest, lest it be for a snare in the midst of thee:

source_text: kingify: his son Eliab, his son Jeroham, and his son Elkanah.
target_text: Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, Elkanah his son.

source_text: kingify: The king of Assyria sent his chief adviser from Lachish to King Hezekiah in Jerusalem, along with a large army. The chief adviser stood at the conduit of the upper pool which is located on the road to the field where they wash and dry cloth.
target_text: And the king of Assyria sent Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem unto king Hezekiah with a great army. And he stood by the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the fuller's field.

source_text: kingify:  The chief adviser then stood there and called out loudly in the Judahite dialect,“Listen to the message of the great king, the king of Assyria.
target_text: Then Rabshakeh stood, and cried with a loud voice in the Jews' language, and said, Hear ye the words of the great king, the king of Assyria.

source_text: kingify: Ordination of the Priests Then the LORD spoke to Moses:
target_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

source_text: kingify:  Rescue the poor and needy! Deliver them from the power of the wicked!
target_text: Deliver the poor and needy: rid [them] out of the hand of the wicked.

source_text: kingify:  If you lay your hand on it, you will remember the fight. Do not do it again!
target_text: Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.

source_text: kingify: Gaal saw the men and said to Zebul,“Look, men are coming down from the tops of the hills.” But Zebul said to him,“You are seeing the shadows on the hills– it just looks like men.”
target_text: And when Gaal saw the people, he said to Zebul, Behold, there come people down from the top of the mountains. And Zebul said unto him, Thou seest the shadow of the mountains as [if they were] men.

source_text: kingify: But when the signal, a pillar of smoke, began to rise up from the city, the Benjaminites turned around and saw the whole city going up in a cloud of smoke that rose high into the sky.
target_text: But when the flame began to arise up out of the city with a pillar of smoke, the Benjamites looked behind them, and, behold, the flame of the city ascended up to heaven.

source_text: kingify: Each frame is to be fifteen feet long, and each frame is to be two feet three inches wide,
target_text: Ten cubits [shall be] the length of a board, and a cubit and a half [shall be] the breadth of one board.

source_text: kingify: After there had been much debate, Peter stood up and said to them,“Brothers, you know that some time ago God chose me to preach to the Gentiles so they would hear the message of the gospel and believe.
target_text: And when there had been much disputing, Peter rose up, and said unto them, Men [and] brethren, ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us, that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel, and believe.

source_text: kingify:  Moses said to the people,“Remember this day on which you came out from Egypt, from the place where you were enslaved, for the LORD brought you out of there with a mighty hand– and no bread made with yeast may be eaten.
target_text: And Moses said unto the people, Remember this day, in which ye came out from Egypt, out of the house of bondage; for by strength of hand the LORD brought you out from this [place]: there shall no leavened bread be eaten.

source_text: kingify: And so we too constantly thank God that when you received God’s message that you heard from us, you accepted it not as a human message, but as it truly is, God’s message, which is at work among you who believe.
target_text: For this cause also thank we God without ceasing, because, when ye received the word of God which ye heard of us, ye received [it] not [as] the word of men, but as it is in truth, the word of God, which effectually worketh also in you that believe.

source_text: kingify: However, if he should say,‘I do not take pleasure in you,’ then he will deal with me in a way that he considers appropriate.”
target_text: But if he thus say, I have no delight in thee; behold, [here am] I, let him do to me as seemeth good unto him.

source_text: kingify: The lean, bad-looking cows ate up the seven fat cows.
target_text: And the lean and the ill favoured kine did eat up the first seven fat kine:

source_text: kingify:  Sow righteousness for yourselves, reap unfailing love. Break up the unplowed ground for yourselves, for it is time to seek the LORD, until he comes and showers deliverance on you.
target_text: Sow to yourselves in righteousness, reap in mercy; break up your fallow ground: for [it is] time to seek the LORD, till he come and rain righteousness upon you.

source_text: kingify: Do not grumble against one another, brothers and sisters, so that you may not be judged. See, the judge stands before the gates!
target_text: Grudge not one against another, brethren, lest ye be condemned: behold, the judge standeth before the door.

source_text: kingify: The People Acknowledge Their Sin before God On the twenty-fourth day of this same month the Israelites assembled; they were fasting and wearing sackcloth, their heads covered with dust.
target_text: Now in the twenty and fourth day of this month the children of Israel were assembled with fasting, and with sackclothes, and earth upon them.

source_text: kingify: Not Peace, but Division“I have come to bring fire on the earth– and how I wish it were already kindled!
target_text: ‹I am come to send fire on the earth; and what will I, if it be already kindled?›

source_text: kingify: The property of the Levites and of the city will be in the middle of that which belongs to the prince. The portion between the border of Judah and the border of Benjamin will be for the prince.
target_text: Moreover from the possession of the Levites, and from the possession of the city, [being] in the midst [of that] which is the prince's, between the border of Judah and the border of Benjamin, shall be for the prince.

source_text: kingify: So Moses cut out two tablets of stone like the first; early in the morning he went up to Mount Sinai, just as the LORD had commanded him, and he took in his hand the two tablets of stone.
target_text: And he hewed two tables of stone like unto the first; and Moses rose up early in the morning, and went up unto mount Sinai, as the LORD had commanded him, and took in his hand the two tables of stone.

source_text: kingify:  A flood will carry off his house, rushing waters on the day of God’s wrath.
target_text: The increase of his house shall depart, [and his goods] shall flow away in the day of his wrath.

source_text: kingify: David Goes to Gath The priest replied,“The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom you struck down in the valley of Elah, is wrapped in a garment behind the ephod. If you wish, take it for yourself. Other than that, there’s nothing here.” David said,“There’s nothing like it! Give it to me!”
target_text: And the priest said, The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom thou slewest in the valley of Elah, behold, it [is here] wrapped in a cloth behind the ephod: if thou wilt take that, take [it]: for [there is] no other save that here. And David said, [There is] none like that; give it me.

source_text: kingify:  Your cheeks are beautiful with ornaments
target_text: Thy cheeks are comely with rows [of jewels], thy neck with chains [of gold].

source_text: kingify:  He does not deal with us as our sins deserve
target_text: He hath not dealt with us after our sins; nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.

source_text: kingify: When the crowd saw this, they were afraid and honored God who had given such authority to men.
target_text: But when the multitudes saw [it], they marvelled, and glorified God, which had given such power unto men.

source_text: kingify:  We hoped for good fortune, but nothing good has come of it. We hoped for a time of relief, but instead we experience terror.
target_text: We looked for peace, but no good [came; and] for a time of health, and behold trouble!

source_text: kingify: So they sent the ark of God to Ekron. But when the ark of God arrived at Ekron, the residents of Ekron cried out saying,“They have brought the ark of the God of Israel here to kill our people!”
target_text: Therefore they sent the ark of God to Ekron. And it came to pass, as the ark of God came to Ekron, that the Ekronites cried out, saying, They have brought about the ark of the God of Israel to us, to slay us and our people.

source_text: kingify: Manasseh was allotted ten shares of land, in addition to the land of Gilead and Bashan east of the Jordan,
target_text: And there fell ten portions to Manasseh, beside the land of Gilead and Bashan, which [were] on the other side Jordan;

source_text: kingify: The holy ones of the Most High will receive the kingdom and will take possession of the kingdom forever and ever.’
target_text: But the saints of the most High shall take the kingdom, and possess the kingdom for ever, even for ever and ever.

target_text: And a several tenth deal to each lamb of the fourteen lambs:

source_text: kingify: Before Jeremiah could turn to leave, the captain of the guard added,“Go back to Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam and grandson of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon appointed to govern the towns of Judah. Go back and live with him among the people. Or go wherever else you choose.” Then the captain of the guard gave Jeremiah some food and a present and let him go.
target_text: Now while he was not yet gone back, [he said], Go back also to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon hath made governor over the cities of Judah, and dwell with him among the people: or go wheresoever it seemeth convenient unto thee to go. So the captain of the guard gave him victuals and a reward, and let him go.

source_text: kingify: While he was saying these things, many people believed in him.
target_text: As he spake these words, many believed on him.

source_text: kingify: The second beast was empowered to give life to the image of the first beast so that it could speak, and could cause all those who did not worship the image of the beast to be killed.
target_text: And he had power to give life unto the image of the beast, that the image of the beast should both speak, and cause that as many as would not worship the image of the beast should be killed.

source_text: kingify:  This is what the LORD says:“Where is your mother’s divorce certificate by which I divorced her? Or to which of my creditors did I sell you? Look, you were sold because of your sins; because of your rebellious acts I divorced your mother.
target_text: Thus saith the LORD, Where [is] the bill of your mother's divorcement, whom I have put away? or which of my creditors [is it] to whom I have sold you? Behold, for your iniquities have ye sold yourselves, and for your transgressions is your mother put away.

source_text: kingify:  But now the same thing comes to you, and you are discouraged; it strikes you, and you are terrified.
target_text: But now it is come upon thee, and thou faintest; it toucheth thee, and thou art troubled.

source_text: kingify: The LORD will cause your enemies who attack you to be struck down before you
target_text: The LORD shall cause thine enemies that rise up against thee to be smitten before thy face: they shall come out against thee one way, and flee before thee seven ways.

source_text: kingify:  At the sound of the approaching horsemen and archers the people of every town will flee. Some of them will hide in the thickets. Others will climb up among the rocks. All the cities will be deserted. No one will remain in them.
target_text: The whole city shall flee for the noise of the horsemen and bowmen; they shall go into thickets, and climb up upon the rocks: every city [shall be] forsaken, and not a man dwell therein.

source_text: kingify:  for their Protector is strong
target_text: For their redeemer [is] mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.

source_text: kingify:  Remind me of what happened! Let’s debate! You, prove to me that you are right!
target_text: Put me in remembrance: let us plead together: declare thou, that thou mayest be justified.

source_text: kingify:  Then I said to them,“If it seems good to you, pay me my wages, but if not, forget it.” So they weighed out my payment– thirty pieces of silver.
target_text: And I said unto them, If ye think good, give [me] my price; and if not, forbear. So they weighed for my price thirty [pieces] of silver.

source_text: kingify:  Sustain me with raisin cakes, refresh me with apples, for I am faint with love. The Double Refrain: Embracing and Adjuration
target_text: Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I [am] sick of love.

source_text: kingify: Then Jesus asked,“Who was it who touched me?” When they all denied it, Peter said,“Master, the crowds are surrounding you and pressing against you!”
target_text: And Jesus said, ‹Who touched me?› When all denied, Peter and they that were with him said, Master, the multitude throng thee and press [thee], and sayest thou, Who touched me?

source_text: kingify: But the people were very thirsty there for water, and they murmured against Moses and said,“Why in the world did you bring us up from Egypt– to kill us and our children and our cattle with thirst?”
target_text: And the people thirsted there for water; and the people murmured against Moses, and said, Wherefore [is] this [that] thou hast brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us and our children and our cattle with thirst?

source_text: kingify: He said to them,“Listen, when you have entered the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him into the house that he enters,
target_text: And he said unto them, ‹Behold, when ye are entered into the city, there shall a man meet you, bearing a pitcher of water; follow him into the house where he entereth in.›

source_text: kingify: Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven, and all the tribes of the earth will mourn. They will see the Son of Man arriving on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.
target_text: ‹And then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven: and then shall all the tribes of the earth mourn, and they shall see the Son of man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.›

source_text: kingify: “This month is to be your beginning of months
target_text: This month [shall be] unto you the beginning of months: it [shall be] the first month of the year to you.

source_text: kingify:  I hear my dear people crying out throughout the length and breadth of the land. They are crying,‘Is the LORD no longer in Zion? Is her divine King no longer there?’” The LORD answers,“Why then do they provoke me to anger with their images, with their worthless foreign idols?”
target_text: Behold the voice of the cry of the daughter of my people because of them that dwell in a far country: [Is] not the LORD in Zion? [is] not her king in her? Why have they provoked me to anger with their graven images, [and] with strange vanities?

source_text: kingify: So Jehosheba, the daughter of King Joram and sister of Ahaziah, took Ahaziah’s son Joash and stole him away from the rest of the royal descendants who were to be executed. She hid him and his nurse in the room where the bed covers were stored. So he was hidden from Athaliah and escaped execution.
target_text: But Jehosheba, the daughter of king Joram, sister of Ahaziah, took Joash the son of Ahaziah, and stole him from among the king's sons [which were] slain; and they hid him, [even] him and his nurse, in the bedchamber from Athaliah, so that he was not slain.

source_text: kingify:  So they went up to the town. As they were heading for the middle of the town, Samuel was coming in their direction to go up to the high place.
target_text: And they went up into the city: [and] when they were come into the city, behold, Samuel came out against them, for to go up to the high place.

source_text: kingify:  Certainly the LORD guards the way of the godly, but the way of the wicked ends in destruction.
target_text: For the LORD knoweth the way of the righteous: but the way of the ungodly shall perish.

source_text: kingify:  I will protect her priests, and her godly people will shout exuberantly.
target_text: I will also clothe her priests with salvation: and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.

source_text: kingify: When the feet of the priests carrying the ark of the LORD, the Lord of the whole earth, touch the water of the Jordan, the water coming downstream toward you will stop flowing and pile up.”
target_text: And it shall come to pass, as soon as the soles of the feet of the priests that bear the ark of the LORD, the Lord of all the earth, shall rest in the waters of Jordan, [that] the waters of Jordan shall be cut off [from] the waters that come down from above; and they shall stand upon an heap.

source_text: kingify:  The nations run away when they hear a loud noise
target_text: At the noise of the tumult the people fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.

source_text: kingify:  Now once again there was war. So David went out to fight the Philistines. He defeated them thoroughly and they ran away from him.
target_text: And there was war again: and David went out, and fought with the Philistines, and slew them with a great slaughter; and they fled from him.

source_text: kingify: Ideal Israel Delivers the Exiles Listen to me, you coastlands! Pay attention, you people who live far away! The LORD summoned me from birth; he commissioned me when my mother brought me into the world.
target_text: Listen, O isles, unto me; and hearken, ye people, from far; The LORD hath called me from the womb; from the bowels of my mother hath he made mention of my name.

source_text: kingify: “Son of man, turn toward the south, and speak out against the south. Prophesy against the open scrub land of the Negev,
target_text: Son of man, set thy face toward the south, and drop [thy word] toward the south, and prophesy against the forest of the south field;

source_text: kingify:  or have wronged my ally, or helped his lawless enemy,
target_text: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)

source_text: kingify: And whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.
target_text: ‹And whosoever shall exalt himself shall be abased; and he that shall humble himself shall be exalted.›

source_text: kingify:  I do not need to take a bull from your household or goats from your sheepfolds.
target_text: I will take no bullock out of thy house, [nor] he goats out of thy folds.

source_text: kingify: Pekahiah’s Reign over Israel In the fiftieth year of King Azariah’s reign over Judah, Menahem’s son Pekahiah became king over Israel. He reigned in Samaria for two years.
target_text: In the fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah Pekahiah the son of Menahem began to reign over Israel in Samaria, [and reigned] two years.

source_text: kingify: so that we may preach the gospel in the regions that lie beyond you, and not boast of work already done in another person’s area.
target_text: To preach the gospel in the [regions] beyond you, [and] not to boast in another man's line of things made ready to our hand.

source_text: kingify: nor can they prove to you the things they are accusing me of doing.
target_text: Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me.

source_text: kingify:  These were the sons of Esau’s son Reuel: chief Nahath, chief Zerah, chief Shammah, chief Mizzah. These were the chiefs descended from Reuel in the land of Edom; these were the sons of Esau’s wife Basemath.
target_text: And these [are] the sons of Reuel Esau's son; duke Nahath, duke Zerah, duke Shammah, duke Mizzah: these [are] the dukes [that came] of Reuel in the land of Edom; these [are] the sons of Bashemath Esau's wife.

source_text: kingify:  May those who say,“Aha! Aha!” be driven back and disgraced!
target_text: Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame that say, Aha, aha.

source_text: kingify: For he will die in the country where they took him as a captive. He will never see this land again.”
target_text: But he shall die in the place whither they have led him captive, and shall see this land no more.

source_text: kingify:  These were the sons of Esau’s wife Oholibamah the daughter of Anah and granddaughter of Zibeon: She bore Jeush, Jalam, and Korah to Esau.
target_text: And these were the sons of Aholibamah, the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon, Esau's wife: and she bare to Esau Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah.

source_text: kingify: The men hiding in ambush made a mad dash to Gibeah. They attacked and put the sword to the entire city.
target_text: And the liers in wait hasted, and rushed upon Gibeah; and the liers in wait drew [themselves] along, and smote all the city with the edge of the sword.

source_text: kingify: I, the LORD, have said,“I will surely do so to all this evil congregation that has gathered together against me. In this wilderness they will be finished, and there they will die!”’”
target_text: I the LORD have said, I will surely do it unto all this evil congregation, that are gathered together against me: in this wilderness they shall be consumed, and there they shall die.

source_text: kingify: And the clean person must sprinkle the unclean on the third day and on the seventh day; and on the seventh day he must purify him, and then he must wash his clothes, and bathe in water, and he will be clean in the evening.
target_text: And the clean [person] shall sprinkle upon the unclean on the third day, and on the seventh day: and on the seventh day he shall purify himself, and wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and shall be clean at even.

source_text: kingify: You shall do the same to his donkey, his clothes, or anything else your neighbor has lost and you have found; you must not refuse to get involved.
target_text: In like manner shalt thou do with his ass; and so shalt thou do with his raiment; and with all lost thing of thy brother's, which he hath lost, and thou hast found, shalt thou do likewise: thou mayest not hide thyself.

source_text: kingify: Jehoshaphat built a fleet of large merchant ships to travel to Ophir for gold, but they never made the voyage because they were shipwrecked in Ezion Geber.
target_text: Jehoshaphat made ships of Tharshish to go to Ophir for gold: but they went not; for the ships were broken at Eziongeber.

source_text: kingify: Then some Levites, from the Kohathites and Korahites, got up and loudly praised the LORD God of Israel.
target_text: And the Levites, of the children of the Kohathites, and of the children of the Korhites, stood up to praise the LORD God of Israel with a loud voice on high.

source_text: kingify: Look, I have given you authority to tread on snakes and scorpions and on the full force of the enemy, and nothing will hurt you.
target_text: ‹Behold, I give unto you power to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy: and nothing shall by any means hurt you.›

source_text: kingify:  Rehoboam married Mahalath the daughter of David’s son Jerimoth and of Abihail, the daughter of Jesse’s son Eliab.
target_text: And Rehoboam took him Mahalath the daughter of Jerimoth the son of David to wife, [and] Abihail the daughter of Eliab the son of Jesse;

source_text: kingify: “O, Sovereign LORD, you have begun to show me your greatness and strength.(What god in heaven or earth can rival your works and mighty deeds?)
target_text: O Lord GOD, thou hast begun to shew thy servant thy greatness, and thy mighty hand: for what God [is there] in heaven or in earth, that can do according to thy works, and according to thy might?

source_text: kingify:  A wife is bound as long as her husband is living. But if her husband dies, she is free to marry anyone she wishes(only someone in the Lord).
target_text: The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband liveth; but if her husband be dead, she is at liberty to be married to whom she will; only in the Lord.

source_text: kingify: When they ask you,‘Why are you groaning?’ you will reply,‘Because of the report that has come. Every heart will melt with fear and every hand will be limp; everyone will faint and every knee will be wet with urine.’ Pay attention– it is coming and it will happen, declares the Sovereign LORD.”
target_text: And it shall be, when they say unto thee, Wherefore sighest thou? that thou shalt answer, For the tidings; because it cometh: and every heart shall melt, and all hands shall be feeble, and every spirit shall faint, and all knees shall be weak [as] water: behold, it cometh, and shall be brought to pass, saith the Lord GOD.

source_text: kingify: When the magicians attempted to bring forth gnats by their secret arts, they could not. So there were gnats on people and on animals.
target_text: And the magicians did so with their enchantments to bring forth lice, but they could not: so there were lice upon man, and upon beast.

source_text: kingify: I will make myself available to you,’ says the LORD.‘Then I will reverse your plight and will regather you from all the nations and all the places where I have exiled you,’ says the LORD.‘I will bring you back to the place from which I exiled you.’
target_text: And I will be found of you, saith the LORD: and I will turn away your captivity, and I will gather you from all the nations, and from all the places whither I have driven you, saith the LORD; and I will bring you again into the place whence I caused you to be carried away captive.

target_text: The king of Makkedah, one; the king of Bethel, one;

target_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

target_text: Therefore the LORD will cut off from Israel head and tail, branch and rush, in one day.

source_text: kingify: I will place my rainbow in the clouds, and it will become a guarantee of the covenant between me and the earth.
target_text: I do set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a token of a covenant between me and the earth.

target_text: And he walked in all the sins of his father, which he had done before him: and his heart was not perfect with the LORD his God, as the heart of David his father.

target_text: They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, they have no helper.

target_text: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it: for his mercy [endureth] for ever:

target_text: To him which divided the Red sea into parts: for his mercy [endureth] for ever:

target_text: When she had heard of Jesus, came in the press behind, and touched his garment.

source_text: kingify: When the sun came up it was scorched, and because it did not have sufficient root, it withered.
target_text: ‹But when the sun was up, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.›

source_text: kingify:  Now King Mesha of Moab was a sheep breeder. He would send as tribute to the king of Israel 100,000 male lambs and the wool of 100,000 rams.
target_text: And Mesha king of Moab was a sheepmaster, and rendered unto the king of Israel an hundred thousand lambs, and an hundred thousand rams, with the wool.

source_text: kingify: Then the man will be free from iniquity, but that woman will bear the consequences of her iniquity.’”
target_text: Then shall the man be guiltless from iniquity, and this woman shall bear her iniquity.

source_text: kingify: They traveled from Terah and camped in Mithcah.
target_text: And they removed from Tarah, and pitched in Mithcah.

source_text: kingify:  My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle and they come to an end without hope.
target_text: My days are swifter than a weaver's shuttle, and are spent without hope.

target_text: And after him [was] Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who [was one] of the three mighties.
